name: Volunteer
description:
Using a battle cry or call sign, you find someone involved in your cause nearby, willing to assist you for as long as you need them to. They are trained in one Skill of your choice.

You can recruit a new volunteer whenever you like, but only one volunteer can accompany you at a time. Once you dismiss a volunteer, they are no longer a Contact.
itemeffect: You can change the volunteer at any time, circumstances allowing.

name: <hide>
itemname: Video game interface device (of your choice)

name: Favorable Acquisition
description: Through your trade dealings, you get your hands onto two Moderately Priced Items, one Expensive Item and one Very Expensive Item of your choice (at no extra cost to you).

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Wireless communications node that ensures that you can always communicate with your allies, no matter where they are located.

name: Interface Node
description: You have a special piece of Cyberware installed in your head that enables you to process large amounts of data and access networks effortlessly.
itemeffect: Interface node that enables you to process large amounts of data and access networks effortlessly

name: Underworld Contact
description: You know many people in a variety of communities who engage in illegal activities. These people are not necessarily your friends and might not be trustworthy, but they recognize you as a peer. You have one Contact in particular that you trust above all others to assist you with your own illicit activities.

name: Underwater Breathing Device
description: You have a special device that, when fitted in your mouth, allows you to breathe underwater. The device functions for up to four hours at a time, after which you must wait four hours before you can use it again.

name: Tradeskill
description: You are trained in one tradeskill of your choice, such as plumbing, electrical repair, carpentry, etc.

name: Tradeskill
description: You are trained in one tradeskill of your choice, such as plumbing, electrical repair, carpentry, etc.

name: Talisman
description: You have a powerful talisman that allows you to transfer the effects of an Intrusion to a target in long range (though you still fail the roll).
itemeffect: You can use this talisman to transfer the effect of an Intrusion to a target in long range.

name: <hide>
itemname: Sports gear as clothing or weapon (of your choice)

name: Trusty Weapon
description: You are skilled in a specific weapon of your choice that you use to hunt beasts. This is a particular weapon, and not a weapon type in which you are skilled.

name: Social Aptitude
description: You're something of a social expert. You're trained in two specific social entertainment Skills of your choice: dancing, karaoke, a team sport, wine tasting, playing tabletop games, and so on.

name: Gamer
description: Pick any one style of game such as real-time strategy games, games of chance in the style of poker, role playing games, and so on. You are skilled in that type of game.
itemname: Skill at a style of game (of your choice)

name: Adaptor
description: Living on the road long enough, you learn to do a little of everything. Anytime you take your Long Rest, you can choose one Skill to be trained in. This lasts until your Long Rest, at which point you choose a new Skill (or the same one again).
itemname: Skill (of your choice, change every Long Rest)

name: Shield
description: You have a shield, shield matrix or energy shield.

name: Seal of Service
description: You have papers, a seal, or other proof that identifies you as a member of an auxiliary military order fighting on behalf of a particular state. You can use this identification in interactions if the particular state or the mercenary group to which you belong is relevant to the interaction. For instance, if you are interrogating a captive, you might suggest that your connection to the military or state could provide leniency if answers were forthcoming. Even if the identification is out of date, you might still get some use out of it if an NPC you're interacting with doesn't realize it.

name: <hide>
itemname: Science Skill of your mentor (whatever that may be)

name: Robot Assistant
description: A robot (built by you) accompanies you and follows your instructions. If the robot is destroyed, you can repair the original with a few days worth of tinkering, or build a new one with a weeks worth of half-time labour.
itemeffect: A robot of your size or smaller (built by you) accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: A robot of your size or smaller (built by you) accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: Robot Fleet
description: You build up to two robots, each no larger than yourself. (They are in addition to the assistant you built when you were Tier 1, which has seen a few upgrades since then.) If a robot is destroyed, you can build a new one (or repair the old one from its parts) after a week of half-time labour.
itemeffect: A robot of your size or smaller (built by you) accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: You can ask them to run errands for you, help you in social interactions, or even escape combat.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: You can ask them to run errands for you, help you in social interactions, or even escape combat.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: You can ask them to run errands for you, help you in social interactions, or even escape combat.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: You can ask them to run errands for you, help you in social interactions, or even escape combat.

name: Retinue
description: Your name entitles you to a retinue that accompanies you wherever you go unless you purposefully disband it. The retinue is composed of five attendants. You can ask them to deliver things for you, run messages, pick up objects of interest or Items on a listpretty much whatever you want, within reason. They can also run interference if you're trying to avoid someone, help hide you from the attention of others, help you muscle through a crowd, and so on. If a situation becomes physically violent, they can try to hold a targets attention while you escape, though they will not engage in combat directly.
itemeffect: You can ask them to run errands for you, help you in social interactions, or even escape combat.

name: <hide>
itemname: Repair Skill (specific objects of your choice)

name: Have Envirosuit, Will Travel
description: Somehow or another, you became the legal owner of a fully functional and advanced precursor envirosuit. The spacesuit allows you to survive in the vacuum of space using suit reserves for up to twelve hours at a time, with enough fuel to get around in zero gravity on jets of ionized gas for that same period. After each use, the suit must be recharged, either with charged energy cells or by allowing the suit to sit idle for at least two hours, during which time it will recharge both air and reaction mass using integrated solid state mechanisms. The suits power supply is an embedded, pure crystal, which means itll function for a few decades before needing to be changed out.

name: Higher Power
description: You now possess a Contact in a position of power, such as a powerful political figure or the leader of a village. They support your cause and may fight alongside you when dealing in matters related to that cause.
itemeffect: A Contact in a position of power, such as a powerful political figure or the leader of a village.

name: Identity
description: Choose one non-combat Skill to be trained in for each personality. You only have access to this Skill when the respective personality is active.

name: Well-defined Identity
description: Choose one non-combat Skill to be trained in for each personality. You only have access to this Skill when the respective personality is active.

name: PERL Instructor
description: You have identification that proves your position of authority as an instructor of other Recondites with PERL. Your identification acts both as Recondite registration and as a means to exert some authority over citizens of the Coalition of Planets.

name: Sleight-of-hand
description: Choose one non-combat trick, foil, or feint to be your specialty. You are trained in Tasks related to it. For example, you might choose a distracting card trick as your specialty. If you successfully distract your target with the trick, you gain an additional die in your dice pool on any Task involving that trick, whether it be persuasion, pickpocketing, or something else.
itemname: Non-combat trick, foil, or feint (of your choice)

name: Mysterious Item
description: You have in your possession an Item which you have no idea what it is, what it does or what its purpose is.

name: <hide>
itemname: Musical instrument or performance tools (of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Mount or vehicle care Skill (your choice)

name: Mount
description: A creature serves you as a mount and follows your instructions. Whether you're mounted on it or not, the creature can move and Attack on your turn. If your mount dies, you can hunt in the wild for 3d6 days to find a new one.
itemeffect: A creature serves you as a mount and follows your instructions.

name: Monster Lore
description: You are trained in the names, habits, suspected lairs, and related topics regarding monsters of lore of the majority civilizations of the world you start on. You are also practiced in the language of that civilization.
itemname: Monster lore (of the majority civilization of the world you start on)

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Protects your implants and enhancements from disruption or Intrusion.

name: <hide>
itemname: Member of your entourage (of your choice)
itemeffect: Can run errands and intercept social interactions, but will not engage in combat.

name: <hide>
itemname: Member of your entourage (of your choice)
itemeffect: Can run errands and intercept social interactions, but will not engage in combat.

name: <hide>
itemname: Member of your entourage (of your choice)
itemeffect: Can run errands and intercept social interactions, but will not engage in combat.

name: <hide>
itemname: Member of your entourage (of your choice)
itemeffect: Can run errands and intercept social interactions, but will not engage in combat.

name: <hide>
itemname: Member of your entourage (of your choice)
itemeffect: Can run errands and intercept social interactions, but will not engage in combat.

name: Machine Companion
description: You create an animate, intelligent machine that accompanies you and acts as you direct. If the machine is destroyed, it takes you one month to create a new one.
itemeffect: An animate, intelligent machine that accompanies you and acts as you direct.

name: <hide>
itemname: Lore Skill (of your choice, change every Long Rest)

name: Legal Intern
description: You gain a Companion who is mostly interested in helping with your law-related Tasks, but might also help you in other areas.
itemeffect: A Companion who is mostly interested in helping with your law-related Tasks, but might also help you in other areas.

name: <hide>
itemname: Language Skill (of the majority civilization of the world you start on)

name: Important Contact
description: You have an important Contact who is in a position of influence, such as a member of the capitalist elite, the captain of a dragoon corps or militia, or the leader of a raider clan.
itemeffect: Someone who is in an influential, such as a member of the capitalist elite, the captain of a dragoon corps or militia, or the leader of a raider clan.

name: <hide>
itemname: Harness or collar (or similar, of your choice)

name: Devoted Groupie
description: You gain a groupie who is completely devoted to you and follows you wherever you go. If you lose your groupie for any reason, you gain a new one after at least two weeks pass.
itemeffect: A groupie who is completely devoted to you and follows you wherever you go.

name: Due Diligence
description: After each Long Rest, choose one Skill that you believe will clearly help you reach a particular goal. You are trained in Tasks related to achieving that goal.
itemname: Goal-related Skill (of your choice, change each Long Rest)

name: Gifted Artifact
description: Thanks to your insolent behavior, you have an additional Artifact, given to you by someone who, having reached the breaking point over your impudence, offered you the object if you would just go away.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: <hide>
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: <hide>
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: <hide>
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: Band of Followers
description: You gain five NPC Companions who are completely devoted to you. If a follower dies, you gain a new one after at least two weeks and proper recruitment.
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: Follower
description: You gain an NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you. If the follower dies, you gain a new one after at least two weeks and proper recruitment.
itemeffect: An NPC Companion who is completely devoted to you

name: Flaw Remover
description: You have an Artifacta device that can mark a simple rune on objects, characters and creatures to make them invisible to your ability to sense their flaws for one year.
itemeffect: A device that can mark a simple rune on objects, characters and creatures to make them invisible to your ability to sense their flaws for one year.

name: Fetish
description: You have a powerful carved fetish. The effects of this fetish are tied directly into your character choices. Maybe the fetish protects you against damage, or provides you with an extra die, or allows you to speak to spirits.
itemeffect: The effects of this fetish are tied directly into your character choices. Maybe the fetish protects you against damage, or provides you with an extra die, or allows you to speak to spirits.

name: Fence
description: You've developed a network of people who will buy stolen goods from you, though trying to get a fence to buy a particularly hot Item (like a firearm) may require some negotiation. You have one fence in particular who helps you broker deals with other people in your network.

name: Familiar
description: You possess a loyal and highly intelligent animal. When the animal is within immediate range, add a die to your dice pool on Magical Tasks.
itemeffect: When the animal is within immediate range, add a die to your dice pool on Magical Tasks.

name: Six Explosive Devices
description:
A selection of six explosive devices. Grenades can be thrown a short range and inflict damage to everyone in an immediate radius. Explosives & mines also inflict damage to everything in an immediate radius; however, these explosives must be set prior to use and must include a trigger in order to be set off. Rather than damage, you could substitute any of these:
  • Incendiary Deals fire damage and fills area momentarily with flame.
  • Electromagnetic Damages and disables electronic devices.
  • Smoke Smoke fills immediate area of explosion.
  • Tear Gas Blinds targets in the immediate area of explosion, who must spend an Action to move and clear their eyes. Even if you fail, targets are still dazed.
  • Stun Targets are stunned. Even if you fail, all targets are deafened and dazed.
  • Breaching Mine Deals damage to applied target.

name: Experimental Weapon
description: An experimental weapon of your own making, possibly made from an existing weapon or made from scrap

name: Enviro Scanner
description: This multifunction device can receive radio transmissions, automatically map locations the wearer has visited, play various forms of media, and keep voice and written records. Also, the wearer can scan for specific materials, toxic traces, and life forms within short range.

name: Crystal Sphere
description: You possess a polished crystal sphere about 3 inches (8 cm) in diameter. The spheres highly polished surface looks as if it reflects your surroundings, but examining its surface reveals that it reflects the surroundings of another location, one you have not yet found. In the images shown on the sphere, you have seen many strange and unsettling things.
itemeffect: Examining its surface reveals that it reflects the surroundings of another location, one you have not yet found.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Contact who can help you embed crystals into your skin.

name: Crystal Artifact
description: A crystal-infused Artifact that whispers to you when no else is around, convincing you that the end is nigh.
itemeffect: Whispers to you when no else is around, convincing you that the end is nigh.

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: Crafting Gear
description: You begin the game with a bag of light tools, the tools needed to make Tier 1 crafts, and any normal Item that you can make with your Skills.

name: Crafting Gear
description: You begin the game with a bag of light tools, the tools needed to make Tier 2 crafts and one physical Item you can carry.

name: Connected
description: You know people who get things donenot just respected people in positions of authority, but also a variety of online hackers and regular street criminals. These people are not necessarily your friends and might not be trustworthy, but they owe you a favor. You have one Contact in particular who you trust above all, or who owes you a lot of favours.

name: Offworlder
description: Members of the T'av race are expected to live out their whole lives on Azod, only leaving when necessary and always coming back within a set amount of time. Regardless of your circumstances, you are or will be an offworlder. You must find a new home for yourself. Select another civilization to become trained in their civil norms.

name: Wards & Inhibitors
description: You have a small collection of Magical wards and inhibitors, and some charms that you believe help you hunt and destroy Recondites.

name: Legal Wear
description: Clothing that identifies you as an interpreter of the law for your culture, and some kind of object that carries information related to your current case. For a lawyer on Plumeth, this may be a datapad, while a T'av diplomat may have a memory stone with their tribe's laws.

name: Beast Companion
description: A creature accompanies you, follows your instructions and acts on your turn. Its movement is based on its creature type (avian, swimmer, and so on). If your beast Companion dies, you can hunt in the wild for 1d6 days to find a new Companion.
itemeffect: A creature of your size or smaller accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: Beast Companion
description: A creature accompanies you, follows your instructions and acts on your turn. Its movement is based on its creature type (avian, swimmer, and so on). If your beast Companion dies, you can hunt in the wild for 1d6 days to find a new Companion.
itemeffect: A creature of your size or smaller accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: Beast Companion
description: A creature accompanies you, follows your instructions and acts on your turn. Its movement is based on its creature type (avian, swimmer, and so on). If your beast Companion dies, you can hunt in the wild for 1d6 days to find a new Companion.
itemeffect: A creature of your size or smaller accompanies you and follows your instructions.

name: Apprentice Explorer
description: You gain an NPC apprentice explorer who is completely devoted to you. If your fellow explorer dies, you gain a new one after at least two weeks and proper recruitment.
itemeffect: An NPC apprentice explorer who is completely devoted to you.

name: A.A.D.A.
description: You build a tiny robot assistant named A.A.D.A (Autonomous Aerial Drone Assistant). It cannot take independent Actions or leave your immediate area. In truth, its more an extension of you than a separate being. Any time you use a device outside of combat and the drone is next to you, it adds a die to your dice pool.
itemeffect: Cannot take independent Actions or leave your immediate area. Any time you use a device outside of combat and the drone is next to you, it adds a die to your dice pool.

name: <hide>
description: Access to a communications array, or some kind of subsystem in your ship or envirosuit.

name: <hide>
description: Choose one non-social, non-combat Task to be trained in. You are somewhat obsessed with this Skill. Add an additional die to your dice pool when performing a Task related to this Skill. Make a note of which Skill you are obsessed with.

name: <hide>
description: Each session, choose one topic or ideal on which you will concentrate. For the rest of that session, you're obsessed with your choice of topic. Make a note of your obsession.

name: <hide>
description: Some distinguishing birthmark or tattoo. Describe what it looks like, where it's located, etc.

name: <hide>
description: You start with a vehicle of your choice.

name: <hide>
description: Choose one character you can see. That character becomes your ward. You are more capable when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your ward. You can have only one ward at a time. Make a note of who this character is.

name: <hide>
description: Select one system to be specialized in. A system might be weapons, shields, thrusters, Vox engines, sensors, etc. You are able to push that system beyond its normal capabilities whenever you wish. Make a note of the system now.

name: <hide>
description: Three allies you can see come under your protection. You can only support one squad at a time, but you can change your squad every time you rest. Make a note of your squadmates now.

name: <hide>
description: Choose up to three characters that you can see. These characters are now under your protection. Make a note of these characters now.

name: <hide>
description: You designate a single character to be your charge. You can change this freely every time you rest, but you can have only one charge at a time. As long as that charge is within immediate range, they cannot get Intrusions from combat because you have their back (though they still fail the roll). Make a note of that charge now.

name: <hide>
description: You know that to survive in this world, you can't go it alone. Choose a nearby ally. That character becomes your scavenging partner. Add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks involving finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting them. You can have only one character so designated at a time. You can change who your fellow survivor is only if they've been out of your company for more than a week, or if they die (and you are aware that they died). Make a note of that character now.

name: A.A.D.A. Scanner
description: Through your A.D.D.A, you scan an area equal in size to a 10-foot (3 m) cube, including all objects, characters or creatures within that area. The area must be within short range. Scanning a target always reveals how powerful, dangerous, or difficult it is. You also learn whatever facts the GM feels are pertinent about the matter and energy in that area. For example, you might learn that the wooden box contains a device of metal and synth. You might learn that the glass cylinder is full of poisonous gas, and that its metal stand has an electrical field running through it that connects to a metal mesh in the floor. You might learn that the creature standing before you is a mammal with a small brain. However, this Ability doesn't tell you what the information means. Thus, in the first example, you don't know what the metal and synth device does. In the second, you don't know if stepping on the floor causes the cylinder to release the gas. In the third, you might suspect that the creature is not very intelligent, but scans, like looks, can be deceiving. Many materials and energy fields prevent or resist scanning.
tooltip: Your A.A.D.A scans a 10-foot cubic area within short range, revealing how powerful or dangerous it is, and any facts pertinent to the area.

name: A.A.D.A. Spy
description: You can send your A.D.D.A. up to a long distance away for up to ten minutes, and see and hear through it as though its senses were your own. You direct its movement.
tooltip: You send your A.D.D.A. up to a long distance away for up to ten minutes, and see and hear through it as though its senses were your own.

name: Able Assistance
description: When you help someone with a Task related to codified knowledge, you can use your Skill in research to add a die to your dice pool as if you were trained in that area of knowledge.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when helping someone with a Task related to an area of knowledge you can research.

name: Abomination
description: As a hybrid of two or more species, you do not fit in anywhere. You feel animosity from almost everyone you meet, with the possible exception of other hybrids. Whenever you get a mixed success from social interactions with non-hybrids, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with non-hybrids, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Absorb Energy
description: You touch a Magical object or being to absorb its energy. If you touch some kind of powered machine or device, the GM determines whether its power is fully drained. In any case, you absorb the energy from whatever it is you touched, restoring some of your health in the process.
tooltip: You touch a Magical object or being, absorbing its energy and restoring some of your health in the process.

name: Acceptable Hybrid
description: Thanks in part to your lineage, it is difficult for most people to differentiate you from "purebreds of your origin species. Or, perhaps people find you exotic enough that they can excuse your parentage. In either case, you do not encounter the social ramifications that are normally associated with being a hybrid. However, you still feel like you cannot belong to any one civilization, as none will accept you as one of their own.

name: Access to a Small Starship
description: With your GMs approval, access to a small starship

name: Access to Knowledge
description: You have access to two exclusive databases on topics of your choice. If living in a primitive society, you have easy, exclusive access to knowledge on two subjects you choose. Note which subjects you have access to.

name: Acclimated
description: You are able to dodge traps with ease. You cannot receive Intrusions related to traps. For example, if you perform a Task in an attempt to avoid a trap and fail, you still fail the roll, but you do not get an Intrusion.
tooltip: You cannot receive Intrusions related to traps (though you can still fail the roll).

name: Ace
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any piloting Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a piloting Task.

name: Acrobatic Attack
description: You leap into the Attack, twisting or flipping through the air. Your movements dazzle your target, dazing them until the end of their next turn. This is in addition to the damage your Attack deals to the target.
tooltip: You leap into the Attack, twisting or flipping through the air, dazing your target in addition to dealing damage.

name: Action Processor
description: Drawing upon stored information and the ability to process incoming data at amazing speeds, you overcome the difficulty of one physical Task of your choice, such as running, climbing, swimming, or Attacks with a specific weapon. Add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a physical Task.

name: Adamantine
description: You're bound by your virtues and what they represent, unwavering in you devotion. You do not get Intrusions when performing a Task that upholds your morals (though you still fail the roll).
tooltip: You do not get Intrusions when performing a Task that upholds your morals (though you can still fail rolls).

name: Adapt to Nature
description: While taking any Action (including fighting) in the wild, add a die to your dice pool if dealing with natural factors such tall grass, thick brush, rugged terrain, weather, and so on.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on a Task (including Attacks) if dealing with natural factors such tall grass, thick brush, rugged terrain, etc.

name: Adaptable
description: You are able to use either Feelings or Logic on any roll, as long as you can justify doing so.
tooltip: You are able to use either Feelings or Logic on any roll, as long as you can justify doing so.

name: Adaptation
description:
You can adapt to any hostile environment: you can breathe safely, the temperature doesn't kill you (though it might be extremely uncomfortable or debilitating), crushing gravity doesn't incapacitate or harm you (though, again, you might be seriously hindered), and so on. This Ability never protects against quick, instantaneous threats, like an Attack with a weapon or a sudden explosion of fire.

Requires an Action to activate, but the effect lasts until you leave the environment you adapted to, at which point you return to your normal state.
tooltip: You adapt to a hostile environment for as long as you remain in that environment, being able to breathe any atmosphere and not being harmed by intense temperatures or gravity.

name: Adaptation
description:
You can adapt to any hostile environment: you can breathe safely, the temperature doesn't kill you (though it might be extremely uncomfortable or debilitating), crushing gravity doesn't incapacitate or harm you (though, again, you might be seriously hindered), and so on. This Ability never protects against quick, instantaneous threats, like an Attack with a weapon or a sudden explosion of fire.

Requires an Action to activate, but the effect lasts until you leave the environment you adapted to, at which point you return to your normal state.
tooltip: You adapt to a hostile environment for as long as you remain in that environment, being able to breathe any atmosphere and not being harmed by intense temperatures or gravity.

name: Additional Upgrades
description:
You can choose another upgrade for your robot assistant. Select one of the following:

  • Force Shield
  • Robotic Flight
  • Mounted Laser Configuration

name: Adrenaline Rush
description: Through a sudden rush of raw strength, you add an additional die to your dice pool when performing a physical Task of your choice. For example, you can choose running, climbing, swimming, or Attacks with a specific type of weapon.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a physical Task.

name: Advanced Health Pack
description: By applying an advanced health pack, you restore a modest amount of health to a target, including yourself.
tooltip: You restore a modest amount of health to a target, including yourself.

name: Advantage
description: When you use 1 XP to reroll a die for any roll that affects only you, change the result by up to 3 on one of your dice.
tooltip: When you use 1 XP to reroll a die for any roll that affects only you, change the result by up to 3 on one of your dice.

name: Advantage to Disadvantage
description: With a number of quick moves, you make an Attack against a target wielding a weapon, disarming them so that their weapon is a short distance away on the ground, or in your handsyour choice.
tooltip: You make an Attack against a target wielding a weapon, disarming them so that their weapon is now a short distance away on the ground, or in your hands.

name: Aeyan
description: Aeyen are native to Erelon, sharing a planet with the Erelen and the K'ohma. Most Aeyen live in relative isolation in a city floating above the planet's largest lake. The Erelan Empire officially recognizes the Aeyen as a part of their commonwealthand by extensionthe Coalition of Planets. However, Aeyen leaders have never sworn themselves to the Erelan Empire, preferring to keep their internal affairs private. Many independent Aeyen travel the star cluster, performing research and exploring as they see fit. Aeyen are naturally curious, though hedonistic and a little arrogant. Their society is caste-based, with a set of strict rules that thrive on social norms and etiquette.

name: After You
description: You can give your Short Rest to an ally, sacrificing all benefits to you (including cooldown resets). You can only do this once between each Long Rest, and you regain your Short Rest the next time you Long Rest.
tooltip: You give your Short Rest to an ally, sacrificing all benefits to you.

name: Again, Again & Again
description: You can Attack three times in the same round.
tooltip: You Attack three times in the same round.

name: Alien Slayer
description: When fighting civilized aliens, you ignore the negative effects of mixed successes, meaning you only need one die to succeed in combat against them.
tooltip: When fighting civilized aliens, you ignore the negative effects of mixed successes.

name: All at Once Now
description: You can take as many Actions this round as you have personalities, meaning you have access to all Abilities for the duration of the round. However, each personality can only act once and may only use the Abilities at their disposal. Only two of your Actions can be Feats.
tooltip: You can take as many Actions this round as you have personalities, and you have access to the Abilities of all of your personalities.

name: All Brains, No Brawn
description: No problem that could be overcome by brute force couldn't just as easily be resolved through smart problem solving. Or at least, that's what you tell yourself. If you get a mixed success on any physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: If you get a mixed success on a physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: All Brawn, No Brain
description: You've never been one to think through a problem. Whenever you get a mixed success on a knowledge Task, you fail instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success on a knowledge Task, you fail instead and get an Intrusion.

name: All Nighter
description: You are able to recover from almost anything. You no longer have short and Long Rests; instead, you always rest for at least two rounds, but you can rest whenever you want. Any cooldowns that require a 'Long Rest' or rest of any kind can be reset by your Power Nap Ability.
tooltip: You no longer have short and Long Rests; instead, you rest by perfomring your Power Nap Feat.

name: All Systems Go
tooltip: You can float and fly in the air for one hour.

name: Alley Rat
description: You find or create a significant shortcut, secret entrance, or emergency escape route where it looked like none existed.
tooltip: You find or create a significant shortcut, secret entrance, or emergency escape route where it looked like none existed.

name: Amalgamation
description:
You have a persistent aura of Shadow, causing your Abilities and Attacks to use Shadow Magic instead of whichever Magic you used previously. If you did not previously use Magic, your Abilities now use Shadow Magic instead, treating every Ability as a Magical Ability (in other words, use your Magic die for every Ability that adds a die to your dice pool, even Tech or mundane ones). However, you are incredibly weak to Divine Magic, and can no longer heal, help, or support other characters in any way.

Shadow Magic is a powerful, yet dangerous Magic that drains its user as much as it does whomever the Magic is aimed at. A Magic of pure destruction, its manifestation alone is enough to erase reality around its nexus. Anyone who is found using Shadow Magic is normally consumed from within before long.
tooltip: All of your Abilities and Attacks now use Shadow Magic (including mundane and Tech ones). You can no longer heal, help or support allies.

name: Amalgamation
description:
You have a persistent aura of Shadow, causing your Abilities and Attacks to use Shadow Magic instead of whichever Magic you used previously. If you did not previously use Magic, your Abilities now use Shadow Magic instead, treating every Ability as a Magical Ability (in other words, use your Magic die for every Ability that adds a die to your dice pool, even Tech or mundane ones). However, you are incredibly weak to Divine Magic, and can no longer heal, help, or support other characters in any way.

Shadow Magic is a powerful, yet dangerous Magic that drains its user as much as it does whomever the Magic is aimed at. A Magic of pure destruction, its manifestation alone is enough to erase reality around its nexus. Anyone who is found using Shadow Magic is normally consumed from within before long.
tooltip: All of your Abilities and Attacks now use Shadow Magic (including mundane and Tech ones). You can no longer heal, help or support allies.

name: Ambush
description: When you Attack a target that has not yet acted during the first round of combat, add a die to your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you Attack a target that has not yet acted during the first round of combat.

name: Anathema
description:
You experience your symptoms with increased intensity. You now have ulcers, sores, malignant growths and wounds that ooze black pus when untreated. You have reduced visual acuity, an inability to speak coherently, incredibly amounts of mental and bodily pain, no appetite, and more; you are essentially on death's door.

Whenever you wish, you can have a Shaman, Keeper, Cleric or Priestess cleanse you to remove the negative social effects caused by your infection (but not the effects on your physical health), though your infection will return in full force within 3 days. Alternatively, you can lean into the infection. In doing so, there's a chance that your actions will not be your own, but there will be no negative social effects (but the effects on your physical health remain) until you next decide to resist the infection.
tooltip: You have visible, malignant growths on your body that severely affect your physical and mental health. You are constantly on death's door.

name: Ancestral Knowledge
description: You look inwards and attempt to commune with your species' ancestors, tapping into their vast wisdom. If you use your Action to ask the GM a question, they must answer honestly. However, the answer can only be something someone for your species' would reasonably have knowledge of. Gaining knowledge of the future is impossible. Can only do once between Rests.
tooltip: You attempt to commune with your species' ancestors, tapping into their vast wisdom, asking the GM a question that they must answer honestly.

name: And Another One
description:
You can choose to apply the last available upgrade to your robot assistant, or choose to apply the existing upgrades to your other robots. Select one:
  • All robots have your robot assistant's existing two upgrades.
  • Force Shield
  • Robotic Flight
  • Mounted Laser Configuration

name: Animal Possession
description: You project your mind into an animals body that you can see, allowing you to control its Actions while your own body lies comatose. This effect ends whenever you choose, or after 24 hours.
tooltip: You project your mind into an animals body that you can see, allowing you to control its Actions while your own body lies comatose.

name: Anti-machine Abilities
description: You find you are much more effective when fighting robots and similar beings. If you have Abilities that normally would not work against robots (like mind control), they will now.
tooltip: If you have Abilities that normally would not work against robots (like mind control), they will now.

name: Apportation
description: You call a physical object to you. You can choose any piece of normal standard equipment, or (no more than once per day) you can allow the GM to determine the object randomly. You can't perform this Feat to take an Item held by someone else.
tooltip: You call a piece of normal standard equipment to you, or you can allow the GM to determine the object randomly.

name: Aquatic Combat
description: Add a die to your dice pool when fighting underwater.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when fighting underwater.

name: Arc Attack
description: If your weapon is capable of reaching or Attacking three targets in quick succession (such as a long staff or an automatic pistol), you can Attack three separate targets within range as a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You Attack three separate targets within range as a part of the same Action.

name: Artistic
description: You're always coming up with some new artistic endeavor. You're trained in any Task related to creating art (such as drawing, painting, or putting together the perfect set of clothing to wear). You can usually sell a piece of art you spend at least ten hours working on it, and you can sell the Item as a Moderately or Expensive Item, depending on your level of Skill.
tooltip: You can usually sell a piece of art you spend at least ten hours working on it, and you can sell the Item as a Moderately or Expensive Item.

name: As Foretold in Prophecy
description: You accomplish something that proves that you are truly the chosen one. You automatically get a critical success on any Task you choose. You can only do this once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You automatically get a critical success on any Task you choose. You can only do this once between each Long Rest.

name: As Your Elder
description: Add a die to any Task roll in which you are teaching, protecting or supporting any member of a civilized species but your own.
tooltip: Add a die to any Task roll in which you are teaching, protecting or supporting any member of a civilized species but your own.

name: Ascension
description:
You become one with the infection, embracing the dark powers from which it was born. You no longer remove a die from your dice pool for physical Tasks, but you keep the negative social effects. You also immediately gain access to all the same Abilities as a Recondite Who Worships Dark Beings, in addition to your current Skill set. If you are already a Recondite Who Worships Dark Beings, you automatically succeed on all of your Magic rolls, so you no longer need to roll for Magic.

There is now a significant chance that your actions will not be your own, but you will generally have more autonomy than you had previously.

Cleansing has no effect on you now.
tooltip: You no longer remove a die for physical Tasks and gain access to new powers, but there's a high chance your actions won't be your own.

name: Ask the Question
description: You can pose a question to a target that can see and understand you that is so insightful, the question distracts it so that it loses its next turn. If you choose to continue asking questions to the same target to keep it pondering for longer than one round, you lose one die from your dice pool each time you ask a question.
tooltip: You pose a question so insightful that the question distracts a target so that it loses its next turn.

name: Ask the Wilds
description: While in the wilderness, you can extend your senses up to a mile in any direction and ask the GM a very simple, general question about that area, such as Where is the orc camp? or Is my friend Deithan still alive? If the answer you seek is not in the area, you receive no information.
tooltip: While in the wilderness, you can ask the GM a very simple, general question about the area in a one mile radius

name: At One With Ancient Powers
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Amalgamation
  • Greater Ethereal Entity

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: At One With the Darkness
description: You body is forever obscured by an aura of darkness, as if light itself cannot escape you. Anyone that stares at you for too long is at risk of being blinded, and anyone that touches you begin to feel fatigued as their life force is being drained away.
tooltip: Anyone that stares at you for too long is at risk of being blinded, and anyone that touches you begin to feel fatigued as their life force is being drained away.

name: At One With the Divine
description: Your body becomes irradiated with Divine light, emitting enough light to illuminate a radius equal to a long range around your body. While active, you shine so brightly that Attacks have a difficult time targeting you, and your Abilities shine with increased brilliance. Lasts up to one minute, or until you use an Action to dim your connection to the Divine.
tooltip: Your body becomes irradiated with Divine light, emitting enough light to illuminate a radius equal to a long range around your body.

name: Attack Flourish
description: With your Attack, you add stylish moves, entertaining quips, or a certain something that entertains or impresses others, adding a die to the dice pool of all characters you choose within short range for their next Task or Attack.
tooltip: You add stylish moves or a certain something on your Attack, adding a die to the dice pool of characters in short range.

name: Attention to Detail
description: You're contemplative, taking time with new situations to give them their proper due. Add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks involving attention to detail, concentration, or focused movements.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for a Task involving attention to detail, concentration, or focused movements.

name: Attune to Nature
description: You have an innate sense of the natural order of things. Once per day, the GM will tell you one fact about the local flora and fauna of the planet you are currently on that is relevant to your current goals, as long as the planet you're currently on supports life.
tooltip: Once per day, the GM will tell you one fact about the local flora and fauna of the planet you are currently on.

name: Attunement
description: Whenever you take the time to commune with the earth element, you can give your allies an additional die on any Task involving earth, rock or metal.
tooltip: After taking the time to commune with the earth element, you give an ally an additional die on any Task involving earth, rock or metal.

name: Augment Vision
description: You suit magnifies your vision, increasing your vision range to 5 miles (8 km). You can also see through mundane materials (such as wood, concrete, plastic, and stone) up to a short distance in false color images.
tooltip: You suit magnifies your vision, increasing your vision range to 5 miles and allowing you to see through mundane materials.

name: Awakened Psi Magic
description:
Whenever you use Magic Abilities from your Focus, you are tapping into the unbound power of Psi. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.

If you have other Magical Abilities, they do not necessarily use Psi Magic.
tooltip: Your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic.

name: Awakening
description:
Choose an Ability from those below, which will represent your budding psionic powers:
  • Icy Layer
  • Premonition
  • Psi Slice
  • Fireball
  • Static Field
  • Telepathic Link

name: Back to Back
description: When you and your friend are within immediate distance of each other, you can choose to switch places mid-Attack. If one friend gets a critical success on any Attack roll, the other friend automatically succeeds on their next Attack.
tooltip: If you get a critical success on any Attack roll, your friend automatically succeeds on their next Attack.

name: Banish
description: You send a target that you touch hurtling into another random dimension or universe, where it remains for ten minutes. You have no idea what happens to the target while its gone, but at the end of ten minutes, it returns to the precise spot it left.
tooltip: You send a target that you touch hurtling into another random dimension or universe, where it remains for ten minutes.

name: Barrier
description: You create a stationary barrier of the element of your choice within immediate range. The barrier is slightly wider and taller than your height, is only as thick as it needs to be for the chosen element and lasts for ten minutes. It can be placed anywhere it fits, as long as it's against whatever element it's made of.
tooltip: You create a stationary barrier of an element of your choice within immediate range.

name: Bash
description: This is a pummeling melee Attack. Your Attack dazes your target for one round.
tooltip: You Attack a target in melee range with a pummeling Attack, dazing them for one round.

name: Bash
description: This is a pummeling melee Attack. Your Attack dazes your target for one round.
tooltip: You Attack a target in melee range with a pummeling Attack, dazing them for one round.

name: Battle Management
description: As long as you spend your Action each round giving orders or advice, your allies within short range add an additional die to their Attack rolls.
tooltip: Your allies within short range add an additional die to their Attack rolls for as long as you give orders to them.

name: Beast Call
description: You summon a horde of small animals or a single large beast to help you temporarily. These creatures do your bidding for as long as you focus your attention, but you must use your Action each turn to direct them. Creatures are native to the area and arrive under their own power, so if you're in an unreachable place, this Ability won't work.
tooltip: You summon a horde of small animals or a single large beast to help you temporarily.

name: Beast Eyes
description: You can sense through your beast Companions senses if it is within 1 mile (2 km) of you.
tooltip: You sense through your beast Companions senses if it is within 1 mile (2 km) of you.

name: Beast Lore
description: You identify a creature, recalling its name, behavior, and habits. Can only do once per creature.
tooltip: You identify a creature, recalling its name, behavior, and habits. Can only do once per creature.

name: Beastlord
description:
None can match your knowledge of beasts or the trust they have in you. Select one of the following:

  • Acquire another beast Companion.
  • Learn how to control hostile beasts.

name: Beastmaster
description:
Your mastery over beasts grows. Select one of the following:

  • Acquire a second beast Companion.
  • Learn how to see your existing Companion(s) eyes.

name: Become Elemental
description: You become the embodiment of an element you choose for one hour. While in this form you no longer need air or sustenance, you are immune to poison and disease, and you can't be knocked down. Additionally, those who touch you take damage from your chosen element.
tooltip: You become the embodiment of an element you choose for one hour. Those who touch you take damage from your chosen element.

name: Berserk
tooltip: You have at least three dice every combat roll, and succeed on mixed successes. You automatically fail positive social interaction Tasks.

name: Berserk
tooltip: You have three dice on every combat roll, only need one die to critically succeed, and fail on all positive social interaction Tasks.

name: Berserker
description:
Anytime you take damage in combat, you must make a single die Logic roll; if you fail, you go berserk. If you succeed, you don't go berserk, even if you want to (you can't choose not to roll, or to use an exact roll as a failure).

While berserk, you have at least three dice total for every combat roll, and your mixed successes are considered regular successes instead (you can still get Intrusions on failed rolls). You automatically fail on all positive social interaction Tasks. For the duration, you Attack every living being within short range, starting with the closest. If no living being is within short range, you move to seek out potential victims.

In addition, sometimes you spontaneously go berserk when angered, surprised, or scared. When this happens, the GM may allow you to attempt a Logic roll to avoid going berserk.

Once you are berserk, you remain so for up to ten minutes, unless you succeed on a Logic roll to return to normal. When you return to your normal state of mind and body immediately after going berserk, remove one die from all rolls for one hour, and you can't go berserk again until after you have taken a Long Rest.
tooltip: Anytime you take damage, make a single die Logic roll. If you fail, you go berserk.

name: Big Game Hunter
description: Add two dice to your dice pool when fighting against targets larger than yourself.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when fighting against targets larger than yourself.

name: Binging Consumables
description: You are able to eat a large amount of food without getting sick, putting most eating contest winners to shame. You don't feel the effects of food poisoning, meaning you are immune to poisons and cannot get sick from eating food.
tooltip: You are immune to poisons and cannot get sick from eating food.

name: Biting Remark
description: You insult a target, adding an additional die to your dice pool to cause severe emotional harm.
tooltip: You insult a target, adding an additional die to your dice pool to cause severe emotional harm.

name: Blaze of Glory
description: You shoot your gun multiples times in quick succession. This Feat may be performed more than once, to make even more Attacks, as long as you remove a die from your dice pool each time you Attack.
tooltip: You shoot your gun multiples times, removing a die from your dice pool for each successive Attack.

name: Blazing Trail
description: You jump to anywhere you choose, in any direction you can see, within long range. If your path of movement was along a solid surface, you leave a trail of fire in your wake.
tooltip: You jump to anywhere you choose, in any direction you can see, within long range. You leave a trail of fire in your wake.

name: Blend In
description: When you blend in, characters and creautres still see you, but they attach no importance to your presence. While blending in, you gain an additional die to your dice pool for stealth Tasks. This effect ends if you do something to reveal your presence or positionAttacking, using an Ability, moving a large object, and so on.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for to attempt to blend in with your surroundings.

name: Blind Machine
description: You deactivate the sensory apparatus of a robot, making it effectively blind. You must either touch the target or strike it with a ranged Attack, dealing damage in the process.
tooltip: You deactivate the sensory apparatus of a robot, dealing damage and making it effectively blind.

name: Blinding Attack
description: If you have a source of light, you can use it to make a melee Attack against a target. If successful, the Attack deals no damage, but the target is blinded for one minute.
tooltip: You use a source of light to make a melee Attack against a target, dealing no damage, but the target is blinded for one minute.

name: Blink of an Eye
description: You move up to 200 feet (61 m) in one round.
tooltip: You move up to 200 feet (61 m) in one round.

name: Blink of An
description: You move up to 500 feet (152 m) in one round.
tooltip: You move up to 500 feet (152 m) in one round.

name: Blizzard
description: You summon a devastating blizzard centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m). The area within 250 feet (76 m) is assailed by hail and freezing rain for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Structures, characters and creatures are assailed by large pellets of hail, smaller object snap under the weight of freezing rain and surfaces become treacherous to traverse. Creatures and characters are subject to frost damage and may have to warm themselves up, as the GM decides. Furthermore, the blizzard is sufficient to slow down creatures and characters inside until the blizzard dissipates.
tooltip: You summon a devastating blizzard for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures, characters, creatures and terrain in the area.

name: Block for Another
description: If you're using a small, fashionable weapon, you can block Attacks made against an ally within immediate range so that they are not damaged by an Attack in combat.
tooltip: You help an ally in immediate range avoid block all damage from an Attack in combat.

name: Blood Is Power
description: As long as you have some source of blood (or sufficient life force, such as a tree or a field of flowers), you can add an additional Magic die to your dice pool for any roll. If you want, you can use your own life force or blood for the bonus, taking a modest amount of damage in the process.
tooltip: As long as you have some source of blood or sufficient life force, you can add an additional Magic die to your dice pool for any roll.

name: Bolt Rider
description: You can move a long distance from one location to another almost instantaneously, carried by a bolt of lightning. You must be able to see the new location, and there must be no intervening barriers.
tooltip: You move a long distance from one location to another almost instantaneously, carried by a bolt of lightning.

name: Bond
description: Whenever you and your friend are within immediate distance, one of you (but not both) adds an additional die to whatever Task roll they attempt in a given round. You must mutually agree each round who gets the additional die. Unfortunately, if you and your friend are not at least within long range of each other, both of you remove a die from all rolls. If one of you ever dies, the other person removes one die from all dice rolls for one year. If you are alive but your friend isn't, after this year, you can choose a new person to bond with.
tooltip: You OR your friend adds a die to any roll in a given round when in immediate range. Remove a die from all rolls if not in long range of each other.

name: Bond
description: Whenever you and your friend are within immediate distance, both of you add an additional die to whatever Task roll you attempt in a given round. Unfortunately, if you and your friend are not at least within long range of each other, both of you remove a die from all rolls. If one of you ever dies, the other person removes one die from all dice rolls for one year. If you are alive but your friend isn't, after this year, you can choose a new person to bond with.
tooltip: You and your friend add a die to any roll in a given round when in immediate range. Remove a die from all rolls if not in long range of each other.

name: Boulder Toss
description: You launch a nearby boulder that smashes into a target within long range.
tooltip: You launch a nearby boulder that smashes into a target within long range.

name: Brawl
description: Add an additional die to any melee Attack roll (including with your bare fists).
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a melee Attack roll.

name: Breach Cover
description: You place or launch an explosive at a piece of cover, destroying enough of it in one Attack so that anyone previously in cover is fully exposed.
tooltip: You place or launch an explosive at a piece of cover, destroying enough of it in one Attack so that anyone previously in cover is fully exposed.

name: Break Everything
description: Your Attacks against objects automatically succeed when you use a two-handed melee weapon. If Attacking a creature or character using a one-handed melee weapon, add two dice to your dice pool for the Attack instead.
tooltip: You automatically succeed when Attacking objects with a two-handed weapon. Add two dice to your dice pool when Attacking creatures or characters with one-handed weapons.

name: Break Storm
description: You can disperse a natural storm over the course of a few rounds. If the storm is particularly large, you disperse only a portion of it a few miles in radius. If the storm is supernatural or Magical, you suppress the effects of the storm within a protective bubble of wind that surrounds you and anyone standing next to you for one hour.
tooltip: You disperse a natural storm over the course of a few rounds. If the storm is Magical, you suppress the effects of the storm instead.

name: Bribe
description: If you use your Action to bribe someone into doing something for you, add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to you bribe someone into doing something for you.

name: Brilliant Blaze
description:
Your powers manifest in a brilliant, but uncontrollable manner. You can now use your Abilities at will instead of activating them at random.

  • Distortion
  • Escape
  • Fetch
  • Out of Phase
  • Premonition
  • Restore Vitality
  • Suddenly Social
  • Summon Abomination
  • Unexpected Exit
  • What's This In My Pocket?
tooltip: Your powers manifest in a brilliant, but uncontrollable manner. You can now use your Abilities at will instead of activating them at random.

name: Bring it to Me!
description: You can run up to a long distance as your Action if you are passing an Item or weapon over to a party member.
tooltip: You run up to a long distance as your Action and pass an Item or weapon over to a party member.

name: Broker Deal
description: You convince all parties in a negotiation or other social encounter to agree to some kind of compromise. You are able to guide exactly who gives up what, at a rate of one negotiated concession per dice roll.
tooltip: You convince all parties to agree to some kind of compromise, guiding exactly who gives up what, rolling for each concession.

name: Brute Force
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task that requires brute force. Examples include smashing down a barred door, tearing open a locked container, lifting or moving a heavy object, or striking someone with a melee weapon.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for a Task that requires brute force.

name: Brute Strike
description: Add two dice to your dice pool on a melee strike.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on a melee strike.

name: Buffeting Winds
description: You create a constant flow of powerful wind within immediate range that knocks away ranged projectiles, blocks Magic Attacks and pushes back targets. The wind wall covers an area slightly wider and taller than your height, is only as thick as it needs to be to push back enemies, and lasts for ten minutes. It can be placed anywhere it fits, as long as there is air.
tooltip: You create a constant flow of powerful wind within immediate range that knocks away ranged projectiles, blocks Magic Attacks and pushes back targets.

name: Burrow
description: You travel through the ground and emerge a long distance away. You can move anywhere you choose within long range as long as dirt, rocks or other minerals exist continuously between you and your destination.
tooltip: You travel through the ground and emerge a long distance away.

name: Burst of Speed
description: You can take two separate Actions this round. Only one can be a Feat.
tooltip: You take two separate Actions this round. Only one can be a Feat.

name: Call Animal Companion
description: You call upon a creature of a kind you have previously encountered and which inhabits this world. The creature remains for one minute and then returns home. While present, the creature acts as you direct, but this requires no Action on your part.
tooltip: You call upon a creature you have previously encountered, that remains for one minute. While present, the creature acts as you direct.

name: Call Contact
description:
If you have the means to communicate long distances (including internet, messengers, postal service) then you can send a message and one of your Contacts will come to you. This Contact will not put their lives in danger or travel to a deadly place, but they will take some risks to get to you.

Depending on the distance the Contact is from you, it may take them up to a few days to reach you. In any situation where it would take more than a week for a Contact to reach you, they will decline your call to action.
tooltip: You send a message and one of your Contacts will come to you, as long the trip to get to your is not significantly dangerous or impossible.

name: Call Dead Spirit
description: At your touch, the spirit of a target dead no longer than seven days manifests in front of you. The spirit remnant persists for up to a day (or less, if it accomplishes something important to it before then), after which the spirit fades away and cannot return again. The raised spirit remembers everything it knew in life and possesses most of its previous Abilities (though not necessarily its equipment). In addition, it gains the ability to become insubstantial as an Action for up to a minute at a time. The raised spirit is not beholden to you, and it does not need to stay near you to remain manifest.
tooltip: The spirit of a target dead no longer than seven days manifests in front of you, persisting for up to a day.

name: Call in Favor
description: A guard, doctor, Technician, or hired thug in the employ of or allied with an enemy is secretly your ally or owes you a favor. When you call in the favor, the target does what they can to help you out of a specific fix (unties you, slips you a knife, leaves a cell door unlocked) in a way that minimizes the risk of revealing their divided loyalties to their employer or other allies. Each additional time you perform this Feat, remove a die from your dice pool for the Feat roll until your next Long Rest, at which point the bonus goes back to normal.
tooltip: You call in a favor so that a target does what they can to help you out of a specific fix in a clandestine manner.

name: Call Suit
description: Regardless of how far away your are from your suit, you can call it to you. Once it arrives, you can spend an Action to get into it, or use its Abilities without you getting into it. Each Action your suit performs while you're out of it requires an Action on your part.
tooltip: You call your suit to your regardless of where it is. You can use its Abilities without getting into it.

name: Call the Storm
description: If you are outside or in a location that has a ceiling at least 300 feet (91 m) above the floor, you summon a boiling layer of lightning-lit, rumbling clouds up to 1500 feet (457 m) in diameter for ten minutes. During daylight hours, natural illumination beneath the storm is reduced to dim light. While the storm rages, you can spend an Action to send a lightning bolt from the cloud to Attack a target you can see directly. Action to initiate; Action to call down a lightning strike.
tooltip: You call a lightning storm for ten minutes, reducing the level of light in the area and allowing you to Attack targets with lightning bolts.

name: Call to Action
description: You call upon your fellow radicals for a minor favor such as help finding someone or assistance in flooding a congressional office with calls. Usable once per day.
tooltip: You call upon your fellow radicals for a minor favor such as help finding someone or flooding a congressional office with calls.

name: Calm
description: Through jokes, songs, or other art, you prevent a living being from Attacking anyone or anything for one round.
tooltip: Through jokes, songs, or other art, you prevent a living being from Attacking anyone or anything for one round.

name: Calm
description: Through reasoned discourse, appeals to sanity and the common good, and other entreaties, you prevent a target from Attacking anyone or anything for two rounds.
tooltip: You prevent a target from Attacking anyone or anything for two rounds.

name: Can't Touch This
tooltip: You can't Attack, touch, or otherwise affect anything for one round after avoiding a physical Intrusion.

name: Capable Heal
description: You heal a target. You always restore a minimum amount of health, regardless of the roll.
tooltip: You heal a target. You always restore a minimum amount of health, regardless of the roll.

name: Capital Punishment
description: You concentrate a lethal charge of electricity into your fingertips and touch a target. If you get your exact number or a critical success, the target dies outright. Cannot kill PCs through this method.
tooltip: You touch a target, killing them outright if you get a critical success or your exact number.

name: Capture
description: You perform a series of complex fighting moves, disarming and subduing a person.
tooltip: You perform a series of complex fighting moves, disarming and subduing a person.

name: Carefree
description: You succeed more on luck than anything. Whenever you wish, you can roll twice on a Task roll and take the more favourable result.
tooltip: You roll twice on a Task roll and take the more favourable result.

name: Careful Aim
description:
When you shoot a target with a gun, you can choose to hit the target in a precise spot, granting an effect in addition to dealing damage. Some of the possible effects include (but are not limited to) the following:

  • You can shoot an object out of someones hand.
  • You can shoot the leg, wing, or other limb it uses to move, reducing its maximum movement speed to immediate for a few days or until it receives expert medical care.
  • You can shoot a strap holding a backpack, armour, or a similarly strapped-on Item so that it falls off.
tooltip: You shoot a target in a precise spot with your gun, granting an effect of your choice in addition to dealing damage.

name: Careful Demolition
description: You carefully set an explosive device, or perfectly calculate the angle to throw an explosive, making sure it doesn't backfire or set off too early. If you fail the roll for this Attack, you can reroll, but you must accept the second result.
tooltip: You set or launch an explosive, rerolling if the roll fails and accepting the second result.

name: Catching Your Breath
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll for one round after using Speed Burst.

name: Cause Fear
description: You can make one target within immediate distance use their next Action to move away from you.
tooltip: You make one target within immediate range run away from you on their next Action.

name: Cautious
description: You are devious, not quick. Whenever you get a mixed success on an athletic Task roll such as running or jumping, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success on an athletic Task roll such as running or jumping, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.

name: Celestial Magic
description:
Whenever you use Magic, you are drawing on your connection to the goddess Ay'driel, allowing you to use Divine Magic when supporting or healing allies, and Psi Magic when Attacking or subverting your targets (with some exceptions). Individuals can only use Psi Magic so much before succumbing to fatigue or worse, while Divine Magic is strongly tied to spiritual beliefs, so practitioners of Divine Magic normally have a strong sense of conviction to drive them forward.

Erelen theists consider Celestial Magic as its own separate Magical force, even though it appears to share properties with Divine and Psi Magic.
tooltip: You can use Magic. You use Divine Magic when supporting or healing allies, and Psi Magic when Attacking or subverting your targets.

name: Censure
description: Your prayer calls on the Goddess to punish an unworthy target within long range. If the target is an artificial lifeform, spirit, or something similar, it also stands in unwilling awe of the divine energy coursing through it and is unable to act on its next turn. Once exposed to this blessing, the target can't be awed by this Attack again for several hours.
tooltip: Your prayers punish an unworthy target within long range. Also dazes artificial lifeforms, spirits, or similar.

name: Center of Attention
description: A literal beam of pure radiance descends from on high and spotlights you. All targets you choose within immediate range of you fall to their knees and lose their next Action. Affected targets cannot defend themselves and are treated as helpless.
tooltip: A beam of pure radiance descends from on high and spotlights you, causing all targets within immediate range to be stunned for one turn.

name: Changeable
description: Changing tacks sometimes achieves your objective. When you fail at a Task, you can change the way you go about achieving it and roll again to make a second attempt. For example, instead of trying to pick the lock a second time, you might elect to bash the door down. You must accept the result of the second roll if you choose to do so.
tooltip: You can change the way you go about achieving a Task and roll again to make a second attempt, as long as you do something different.

name: Chaotic
description: Once after each Long Rest, you can reroll a die roll of your choice if you don't like the first result. When you do, regardless of the outcome, the GM presents you with an Intrusion.
tooltip: You can reroll a die roll of your choice if you don't like the first result. When you do, the GM presents you with an Intrusion.

name: Charge
description: You can electrically charge an Artifact or other device so that it can be used once. Can also be used to supercharge an object that requires power, making it perform more effectively for one use.
tooltip: You can electrically charge an Artifact or other device so that it can be used or become supercharged once.

name: Charge Attack
description: You can move a short distance and still make an Attack as part of the same Action, assuming you are running toward your target.
tooltip: You move a short distance and make an Attack as part of the same Action, assuming you are running toward your target.

name: Charge the Ranks
description: You can Attack up to four different targets as a single Action as long as they are all along your path and within short range. If you get a mixed success on your roll, you do not suffer any negative effects.
tooltip: You Attack up to four different targets as a single Action as long as they are all along your path and within short range.

name: Charm Machine
description: You convince an unintelligent machine to like you. A machine that likes you is less likely to function if said function would cause you harm. Thus, if a target attempts to detonate a bomb near you controlled by a detonator that likes you, there is a chance that it won't explode.
tooltip: You convince an unintelligent machine to like you so it is less likely to function if said function would cause you harm.

name: Chosen Weapon
description: Add an additional die to your dice pool when using your chosen weapon.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when using your chosen weapon.

name: Citizen
description: You do not have anything special that defines who you are. Maybe you're a villager, a farmer, a trader, a doctor, an office clerk, a hunter or an accountant. You are defined more by your potential than by what you do. Your only skills involve communication with others, or whatever helps you contribute to society.

name: Clay Matter
description: You are able to shape an object you touch as though it were clay, forming it as you see fit for the next ten minutes.
tooltip: You are able to shape an object you touch as though it were clay, forming it as you see fit for the next ten minutes.

name: Clay Matter
description: You are able to shape an object in long range as though it were clay, forming it as you see fit for the next ten minutes.
tooltip: You are able to shape an object in long range as though it were clay, forming it as you see fit for the next ten minutes.

name: Cleanse
description: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.
tooltip: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.

name: Cleanse
description: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.
tooltip: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.

name: Cleansed
tooltip: You no longer remove a die from your dice pool for social interactions, but are still at a disadvantage for everything else.

name: Clear a Path
description: You move the earth, sand and rock in front of you as you move, allowing you and up to ten other characters or creatures within immediate distance to travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours. At this speed, most dangerous encounters or regions of rough terrain are ignored, though the GM may declare exceptions. Outright barriers still present a problem.
tooltip: You move the earth in front of you as you move, allowing you and up to ten other characters or creatures to travel overland at ten times the normal rate.

name: Cognizant Offense
description: During combat, your brain shifts into a sort of battle mode where all potential Attacks you could make are plotted on vector graphs in your minds eye, which always provides the best option. Add an additional die to your dice pool for any kind of Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any kind of Attack.

name: Coiling Flames
description: When you wish it, your halo sprouts three tendrils of flame that last for up to ten minutes. As an Action, you can use the tendrils to Attack, making a separate Attack roll for each. Each tendril inflicts fire damage and can Attack up to a short range away. If you don't use the tendrils to Attack, they remain but do nothing.
tooltip: Your halo sprouts three tendrils of flame that last for up to ten minutes. Each tendril inflicts fire damage and can Attack up to a short range away.

name: Comatose
tooltip: You fall unconscious for at least 10 minutes after using psionic Flare. This counts as an additional Short Rest.

name: Command
description: You issue a simple command to a single living being. The target must be within short range and able to hear and understand you. The command can't inflict direct harm on the target or its allies, so Commit suicide won't work, but Flee might. In addition, the command can require the target to take only one Action, so Unlock the door might work, but Unlock the door and run through it won't.
tooltip: You issue a simple command to a single living being within short range that can hear you.

name: Command
description: You issue a simple command to a single living being. The target must be within short range and able to hear and understand you. The command can't inflict direct harm on the target or its allies, so Commit suicide won't work, but Flee might. In addition, the command can require the target to take only one Action, so Unlock the door might work, but Unlock the door and run through it won't.
tooltip: You issue a simple command to a single living being within short range that can hear you.

name: Command Spirit
description: You can command a spirit remnant or animated dead being within short range. If you are successful, the target cannot Attack you for one minute, during which time it follows your verbal commands if it can hear and understand you.
tooltip: You control the Actions of a spirit remnant or animated dead being within short range for one minute.

name: Commanding Presence
