tooltip: You can rest and recover from your wounds in half the time. Whenever you Rest, you recover twice the amount of health.

name: Fast Talk
description: When speaking with an intelligent being who can understand you and isn't hostile, add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to try to convince the target to take a reasonable action the next time they act. A reasonable action must be agreed upon by the GM; it should not put the target or its allies in obvious danger or be wildly out of character.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to try to convince a target to take a reasonable action the next time they act.

name: Feat of Strength
description: You pick up and throw an incredibly heavy object at a target within short range.
tooltip: You pick up and throw an incredibly heavy object at a target within short range.

name: Fellow Survivor
description: You know that to survive in this world, you can't go it alone. Choose a nearby ally. That character becomes your scavenging partner. Add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks involving finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting them. You can have only one character so designated at a time. You can change who your fellow survivor is only if they've been out of your company for more than a week, or they die (and you are aware they died).
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your fellow survivor.

name: Ferocious Whip
description: Add a die to your dice pool when making Attacks with you whip.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when making Attacks with you whip.

name: Fetch
description:
You cause an object to disappear and reappear in your hands or somewhere else nearby. Choose one object that can fit inside a 5-foot (2 m) cube and that you can see within long range. The object vanishes and appears in your hands or in an open space anywhere you choose within immediate range.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You cause an object to disappear and reappear in your hands or somewhere else nearby.

name: Field Medic
description:
Space is a dangerous place, and Field Medics help support their allies when Magic users are not available. They are capable healers, can provide moral support and even have limited combat ability. Terrans were the first to formally train Field Medics to help with their research expeditions, but they have since become popular with the Coalition of Planets as a whole.

While Field Medics can come from any background, their position requires access to advanced technology. This should be taken into account when building your backstory.

name: Fiery Hand of Doom
description: While your Shroud of Flame is active, you can reach into your halo and produce a hand made of animate flame. The hand acts as you direct, floating in the air. Directing the hand is an Action. Without a command, the hand does nothing. It can move a long distance in a round, but it never moves farther away from you than long range. The hand can grab, move, and carry things, but anything it touches takes damage from the heat. The hand can also Attack. Once created, the hand lasts for ten minutes. Action to create; Action to direct.
tooltip: You can reach into your halo of flames and produce a hand made of animate flame that acts as you direct.

name: Fight Fire With Fire
description:
Through the use of Magic, nanites, drugs, or biomechanical alterations, you give yourself Magical Abilities. Select one of the following:

  • Erase Memories
  • Far Step
  • See the Unseen
  • Shatter

You're always quick to point out that these Abilities do not make you a Recondite, but only better at hunting them. Unless otherwise decided by you and the GM, these Abilities use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.

name: Fight Tyranny
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you Attack a target who is a tyrant, bully, or is currently oppressing the weak or innocent. You determine whether someone's actions are oppressive or not.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you Attack a target who is a tyrant, bully, or is currently oppressing the weak or innocent.

name: Figured Out
description: If you have recorded or know at least three facts about a target, object or location, and you have Insight relevant to this same target, add three dice to your dice pool for a Task related to the target.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool on a Task related to a target for which you know three facts and have related Insight.

name: Filled With Determination
description: No matter how difficult the road ahead is, or what obstacles stand in your way, you always find a way to overcome life's challenges. Whenever you visit a significantly new location or experience someone else attaining their goals, gain 1 XP and heal to full health. The GM will determine what would be considered a significantly new location (examples: metropolis, nature reserve, new world, etc.).
tooltip: Whenever you visit a significantly new location or experience someone else attaining their goals, gain 1 XP and heal to full health.

name: Filling in the Details
description: If you've used Understand on a character, creature, object, or location within the last few days, you can learn one random fact about the subject that is pertinent to a topic you designate.
tooltip: You learn one random fact about a subject you've previously used Understand on, that is pertinent to a topic you designate.

name: Find All the Traps
description: You notice all traps and the triggers for those traps in the room. Add two dice to your dice pool when trying to determine if there are traps in the room.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when trying to determine if there are traps in the room.

name: Find Hidden
description: You instantly discover all hidden objects, doors, and panels within immediate distance from you, as well as other hidden information, such as Magic or spirits.
tooltip: You instantly discover all hidden elements within immediate distance from you, as well as other hidden information, such as Magic or spirits.

name: Find the Flaw
description: If a target has a straightforward weakness (takes extra damage from fire, can't see out of his left eye, and so on), the GM will tell you what it is if you ask them. You can only perform this Feat once per target.
tooltip: If a target has a straightforward weakness, the GM will tell you what it is if you ask them.

name: Find the Guilty
description: If you have designated someone as guilty, add a die to your dice pool when tracking them, spotting them when they are hidden, or otherwise finding them.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when tracking, spotting, or otherwise finding someone you've designated as guilty.

name: Find the Hidden
description: You see the traceries of objects as they move through space and time. You can sense the distance and direction of any specific inanimate object that you once touched. This takes anywhere from one Action to hours of concentration, depending on what the GM feels is appropriate due to time, distance, or other mitigating circumstances. However, you don't know in advance how long it will take. You remain in contact with the object for one hour. Thus, if it moves, you are aware of its new position. Action to initiate; Action each round to concentrate.
tooltip: You can sense the distance and direction of any specific inanimate object that you once touched for one hour.

name: Find Traps
description: You notice all traps in the room. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to determine if there are traps in the room.
tooltip: You notice all traps in the room. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to determine if there are traps in the room.

name: Finder
description: You can see behind the world and the shadows that all beings and significant objects cast. If you have interacted with a being or object in the past, you can attempt to learn where it is right now. Alternatively, you can cause an object you have personally handled in the past to be transported into your hands so long as the object can fit inside a 5-foot (2 m) cube. If successful, the object vanishes from wherever it was and appears in your hands or in an open space anywhere you choose within immediate range.
tooltip: You learn the location of a being or object you've interacted with before, or transport said object to you.

name: Finishing Blow
description: If your target is prone, stunned, or somehow helpless or incapacitated when you strike, add three dice to your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool for the Attack if your target is prone, stunned, or somehow helpless or incapacitated when you strike.

name: Fire Abilities
description: You are an avatar of fire, a purveyor of fiery destruction. If you so choose, you may appear as an elemental of living flame. Regardless of your form, objects and surfaces you touch catch fire and become scorched. Additionally, any Ability you use that targets a flammable target (and has fire damage) causes the target to catch fire. The target takes ambient damage until the flames are extinguished, which they can do by dousing themselves in water, rolling on the ground, or smothering the flames. The target may put out the flames rather than move on their turn. Cannot set a target aflame until one round has passed since they were last in flames.
tooltip: You cause objects and surfaces you touch to catch fire. Your fire Abilities cause targets to catch fire and burn until extinguished.

name: Fire Elemental
description: You call upon the elements and summon a fire elemental that acts as you direct each round. Directing the elemental is an Action, and you can command it only when you are within long range of it. Without a command, the elemental continues to follow your previous command. You can also give it a simple Action, such as Wait here, and Attack anyone who comes within short range until they're dead. The elemental lasts for ten minutes and deals fire damage when it Attacks. Once it dies, it disappears in a flash and leaves nothing but smoke and ash. Action to create; Action to direct.
tooltip: You call upon the elements and summon a fire elemental that acts as you direct each round.

name: Fire Feet
description: You imbue the energy of fire into you and up to ten other beings within immediate distance, allowing you to travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours. At this speed, most dangerous encounters or regions of rough terrain are ignored, though the GM may declare exceptions. Outright barriers still present a problem.
tooltip: You and up to ten other beings travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours.

name: Fire Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the destructive power of Fire element. All sentient beings have an affinity to the elements, whether they are aware of it or not. You are particularly attuned to the element of Fire, though you still have a connection to the other elements to a certain extent. Those attuned to fire have a burning desire for change and tend to be impatient.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the destructive power of the Fire element.

name: Fire Tendrils
tooltip: Three tendrils of flame coil out from your flame shroud, allowing you to Attack three additional times on your turn.

name: Fire Weapon
description: When you wish it, you can imbue a weapon with Magical flame for one hour. The flame ends if the wielder stops holding or carrying the weapon. While the flame lasts, the weapon benefits from your fire Abilities, dealing fire damage and causing targets to burn.
tooltip: You imbue a weapon with Magical flame for one hour or until the wielder stops holding or carrying the weapon.

name: Fireball
description: You release a ball of concentrated fire that smashes into a target within long range.
tooltip: You release a ball of concentrated fire that smashes into a target within long range.

name: Fireball
description: You release a ball of concentrated fire that smashes into a target within long range.
tooltip: You release a ball of concentrated fire that smashes into a target within long range.

name: Firestorm
description: You summon a raging fire tornado centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m). The area within 250 feet (76 m) is assailed by a firestorm for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Wildfires rage, objects melt under the intense heat and strong winds knock down buildings in the area. Creatures and characters caught in the tornado are subject to fire damage and may have to extinguish themselves, as the GM decides. Furthermore, the sight of the firestorm is enough to frighten characters and creatures, preventing them from acting on their own until the firestorm dissipates.
tooltip: You summon a raging fire tornado that assails objects, structures, characters and creatures in a 250 foot radius.

name: Firewall
description: You create a stationary wall of flames within immediate range. The barrier is slightly wider and taller than your height, is of negligible thickness and lasts for ten minutes. It can be placed anywhere it fits, whether against a solid object (including the ground) or floating in the air. Requires a fuel source of some kind (such as oxygen or oil, i.e. cant be in a vacuum)
tooltip: You create a stationary wall of flames within immediate range.

name: First Blood
description: You automatically succeed on your first Attack roll if you are the first one to Attack in any given combat encounter. Only works for the first round of combat and if you are using a firearm for the Attack.
tooltip: Automatically succeed on your first Attack roll if you are the first one to Attack and you are using a firearm.

name: First Strike
description: The first time you strike a target in combat, add a die to your dice pool for the Attack roll.
tooltip: The first time you strike a target in combat, add a die to your dice pool for the Attack roll.

name: First!
description: If you're the first to speak in a conversation or the one who throws the first punch, add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task if you're the first to speak in a conversation or the one who throws the first punch.

name: Fits of Insight
description: Whenever such knowledge is appropriate, the GM feeds you information although there is no clear explanation as to how you could know such a thing. This is up to the GMs discretion, but it should happen as often as once each session.
tooltip: The GM can feed you information although there is no clear explanation as to how you could know such a thing.

name: Flame Leap
description: You temporarily become a streak of flames, leaping through the air to reappear in your physical form some distance away. You can jump up, down, or across to anywhere you choose within long range if you have a clear and unobstructed path to that location.
tooltip: You temporarily become a streak of flames, leaping through the air to reappear in your physical form some distance away.

name: Flame Wreath
description: You surround a target within a wreath of pure flame, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While inside the wreath, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
tooltip: You surround a target within a wreath of pure flame, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute.

name: Flash
description: You create an explosion at a point within close range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The blast inflicts damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion at a point within close range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point.

name: Flash Across the Miles
description: You can move to an open location while on a planet that you're familiar with almost instantaneously, transformed into a bolt of lightning. You can attempt to penetrate covered locations that you're aware of as long as a route exists from the open air to the area you want to reach that electricity can easily follow.
tooltip: You can move to an open location while on a planet that you're familiar with almost instantaneously, transformed into a bolt of lightning.

name: Flash of Genius
description:
Your powers manifest in a brilliant, but uncontrollable manner. Gain the effect one of the following Abilities by rolling 1d10:

  1. Distortion
  2. Escape
  3. Fetch
  4. Out of Phase
  5. Premonition
  6. Restore Vitality
  7. Suddenly Social
  8. Summon Abomination
  9. Unexpected Exit
  10. What's This In My Pocket?

If you roll an Ability you do not want to use, you must pay an XP as if it were an Intrusion.
tooltip: Your powers manifest in a brilliant, but uncontrollable manner. Gain the effect one of ten random Abilities by rolling 1d10.

name: Flaw in Everything
description:
You see flaws in everyone and everything, so much that you usually veil your flaw-finding eye. However, sometimes you raise that veil, if for just a moment. Usually, you see the flaws in others, but sometimes you see the flaws in yourself. At any point, you can choose to roll only 1d6 for your roll. On an even result, you get a critical success. On an odd result, you get an Intrusion.

If for some reason you are unable to see the flaw in something (through the use of your Flaw Remover, for example), you automatically get mixed successes on Tasks related to the target.
tooltip: You can choose to roll only 1d6 for any given Task roll. On an even result, you get a critical success. On an odd result, you get an Intrusion.

name: Fleet of Foot
description: A target you touch can move further than it would normally be able to in the same amount of time. A normal being affected by this Ability could both move a short distance and take an Action on its turn. Expires after the being takes any Action. The Action can be a Feat, if they so choose.
tooltip: A target you touch can both move a short distance and take an Action on its turn.

name: Flight
description: You or a target you touch can float and fly through the air for one hour. If you bestow the power of flight on someone else, you direct their movements, and while flying, they must remain within sight of you or fall. In terms of overland movement, a flying creature or character moves about 20 miles (32 km) per hour and is not affected by terrain.
tooltip: You or a target you touch can float and fly through the air for one hour.

name: Flight Not Fight
description: If you use your Action only to move, add a die to your dice pool for the Task. You only need one successful die roll to succeed instead of two for this Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you only use your Action to move this turn. You only need one successful die roll to succeed.

name: Fling
description: You violently launch a target within short range and send it flying a short distance in any direction.This inflicts damage to the target being flung when it lands or strikes a barrier. If you aim the primary target at another target, they also takes damage.
tooltip: You violently launch a target and send it flying a short distance in any direction.

name: Flurry
description: You make an extra melee Attack, for a total of two Attack rolls as a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You make an extra melee Attack, for a total of two Attack rolls as a part of the same Action.

name: Fly Off the Handle
description: Once per session, the GM may give you an Intrusion you cannot refuse as your character flies into a fit of rage. You still receive XP for the Intrusion.
tooltip: The GM may give you an Intrusion you cannot refuse as your character flies into a fit of rage. You still receive XP for the Intrusion.

name: Focused Attack
description: Add a die to your dice pool for to Attack target with both of your weapons simultaneously.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for to Attack target with both of your weapons simultaneously.

name: Font of Wisdom
description: Allies with immediate range of you can choose to receive your help without you performing any Actions or rolls. So if you're skilled in a non combat Task they are trying to accomplish, they automatically add a die to their dice pool if within range. However, this kind of help is not enhanced by your other Abilities in any way.
tooltip: Allies with immediate range of you can choose to receive your help on non combat Tasks without you performing any Actions or rolls.

name: Force & Accuracy
description: You need one less die to succeed with Attacks using weapons that you throw. This means you can never fail when Attacking using throwing weapons, you only need one die to succeed and two die for a critical success.
tooltip: You need one less die to succeed with Attacks using weapons that you throw.

name: Force at Distance
description: You temporarily bend the fundamental law of gravity around a target within short range. The target is caught in your telekinetic grip, and you can move it up to a short distance in any direction each round that you retain your hold. A being in your grip can take Actions, but can't move under its own power. Each round after the initial Attack, you can attempt to keep your grip on the target by rolling again. If your concentration lapses, the target drops back to the ground.
tooltip: A target within short range is caught in your telekinetic grip, and you can move it up to a short distance in any direction.

name: Force Blast
description: This Attack pushes your target a short distance away from you. You can perform this Feat in place of your normal weapon roll.
tooltip: Your weapon Attack pushes your target a short distance away from you. You can perform this Feat in place of your normal weapon roll.

name: Force Multiplier
description: If two or more allies with this Feat work together to accomplish a Task, one of you can take an extra Action. The squad members determine who takes the extra Action; however, the same character cant be designated to take the extra Action granted by this ability on consecutive rounds. For example, if three squad members are all Attacking the same enemy, an alternating squad member takes the extra Action provided by this ability from one round to the next. That extra Action is probably to make an additional Attack but doesn't have to be, and can be a Feat if you so choose.
tooltip: If two or more allies with this Feat work together to accomplish a Task, one of you can take an extra Action.

name: Force Shield
description: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for one minute (or until it is destroyed). It cannot do so again until after you Rest.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for up to one minute.

name: Force Shield
description: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for one minute (or until it is destroyed). It cannot do so again until after you Rest.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for up to one minute.

name: Forced Memory
description: You force a target to relive a memory of your choice, dazing them for one round. You must have some inkling that the memory exists to do so.
tooltip: You force a target to relive a memory of your choice, dazing them for one round. You must have some inkling that the memory exists to do so.

name: Foreboding Shadow
description: You Attack your target, causing darkness to momentarily cloud its mind, confusing it for two rounds so that it Attacks and acts randomly for the duration.
tooltip: You Attack your target, causing darkness to momentarily cloud its mind, confusing it for two rounds.

name: Forethought
description: Add three dice to your dice pool on your next Action in the next round, so long as you name that Action now.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool on your next Action in the next round, so long as you name that Action now.

name: Forget My Name
description: You've developed an amazing facility for being forgettable. If you interact with a target and do not Attack it, the target usually forgets having seen you at all.
tooltip: You interact with a target (without Attacking it), causing them to forget having seen you at all.

name: Forgetfulness
description: Your target forgets something of your choice, even something crucial to who they are. This memory lapse lasts ten minutes.
tooltip: Your target forgets something of your choice, even something crucial to who they are. This memory lapse lasts ten minutes.

name: Frantic Movements
description: Your frantic, unpredictable movements make you a slippery customer. You do not suffer negative consequences that come from mixed successes for physical Tasks (including Attacks).
tooltip: You do not suffer negative consequences that come from mixed successes for physical Tasks (including Attacks).

name: Free Hand
description: If you only have one weapon equipped and your other hand is free, you can Attack and perform another Action in the same round (as long as the other Action is not an Attack).
tooltip: You Attack and perform another Action in the same round if one of your hands does not hold a weapon.

name: Free Mind
description: You attempt to free a being whose mind has been suborned by an outside influence. A being that doesn't want to be freed must first be restrained.
tooltip: You attempt to free a being whose mind has been suborned by an outside influence.

name: Freezing Touch
description: Your hands become so cold that the next time you touch a target, you freeze them solid for one round.
tooltip: Your hands become so cold that the next time you touch a target, you freeze them solid for one round.

name: Frenzied
tooltip: While in a state of frenzy, you can only use physical Abilities, but you add a die to your dice pool on all physical Tasks.

name: Frenzy
description: When you wish, while in combat, you can enter a state of frenzy. While in this state, you can't use non-physical Abilities, but you add a die to your dice pool on all physical Tasks. This effect lasts for as long as you wish, but it ends if no combat is taking place within range of your senses.
tooltip: You enter a state of frenzy where you can only use physical Abilities, but you add a die to your dice pool on all physical Tasks.

name: Friendly Face
description:
You have been officially hired by locals to protect them and keep order. You have a title and some authority to go with it. As a result, add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions with those within your patrol area.

You are known beyond the borders of your patrol area and can exert authority anywhere you go.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions.

name: Friendship Bond
description: You and your friend are always in communication with each other, no matter how far apart you are. You always know the direction and distance to your friend, and vice versa. This can be accomplished through technology or telekinesis.
tooltip: You and your friend are always in communication with each other, no matter how far apart you are.

name: From the Dark
description: Add a die to your dice pool when acting or fighting in dimly lit or cramped areas.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when acting or fighting in dimly lit or cramped areas.

name: Fruits of Your Labour
description:
You are trained in the Magic of your choice. If you are already trained, you instead roll at least two Magic dice when using that Magic (when you would normally only roll one Magic die). Select the appropriate option:

  • Trained in the Magic of your choice.
  • Roll at least two Magic dice on all rolls for a specific Magic.

name: Fuel to the Flames
description:
Through the use of Magic, nanites, drugs, or biomechanical alterations, you give yourself Magical Abilities. Select one of the following:

  • Adaptation
  • Cleanse
  • Hover
  • Psi Explosion

You're always quick to point out that these Abilities do not make you a Recondite, but only better at hunting them. Unless otherwise decided by you and the GM, these Abilities use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.

name: Further Experimentation
description:
Select one of the following modifications to apply to your weapon:

  • Go Big
  • Miniaturize

name: Fusion
description: You can fuse Artifacts and some Items with your body as cost-free Cyberware. These fused devices can provide Skills, become additional weapons, etc. but cannot provide bonuses.
tooltip: You attempt to fuse an Artifact or Item into your cyborg body. These fused devices can provide Skills, become additional weapons, etc.

name: Future Sight
description: You catch a glimpse of whats going to happen quickly enough to act on it immediately. If you have sufficient Insight, add three dice to your dice pool on a Task related to the Insight.
tooltip: If you have sufficient Insight, add three dice to your dice pool on a Task related to the Insight.

name: Gain Insight
description: Once after each Long Rest, you can ask the GM if there is an Insight related to your current situation. The Insight might help you with a plan, your method of research, gathering information, scouting, or the pursuit of some other goal. An Insight is a single bit of special knowledge from the GM that you can count on with certainty. This Insight costs you no XP.
tooltip: Once after each Long Rest, you can ask the GM if there is an Insight related to your current situation.

name: Gambler
description:
You have an extra six-sided die that is your Gambler's die. Each day, choose two different numbers from your regular number between 1 and 6. One number is your lucky number, and the other is your unlucky number. You can (but don't have to) roll this die whenever you make any other roll. If you decide to roll the die and you get your lucky number, treat the die roll as a success. But if you get your unlucky number, treat the die roll as a failure.

You must roll this die at the same time as your other dice. You cannot reroll this die. Nothing happens if you get any number other than your lucky or unlucky number.
tooltip: Succeed on an optional 1d6 Gambler's die if you get your daily lucky number, or fail if you get your daily unlucky number.

name: Gaze of Death
description: After spending a round staring at a target, add two dice to your dice pool on your next Attack upon that target thereafter.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on your next Attack on a target after spending a round staring at them.

name: Get Away
description: You can perform an Action and then move up to a short distance, or get behind or beneath cover within immediate range, all as part of the same Action. The Action you perform before moving can be a Feat, if you so choose.
tooltip: You perform an Action and then move up to a short distance, or get behind or beneath cover within immediate range.

name: Get Down!
description: If you're standing next to a character or creature that's about to take damage, you feel compelled to intercede and take the damage yourself. You must use your Action to Take the Attack if someone in immediate range of you is Attacked. This Ability can trigger multiple times in any given round.
tooltip: You must use your Action to Take the Attack if someone in immediate range of you is Attacked.

name: Getting Along
description: You willfully switch between personalities, adding two dice to your dice pool for the roll. You can do this as often as you want, but it requires an Action each time.
tooltip: You willfully switch between personalities, adding two dice to your dice pool for the roll.

name: Getting the Word
description: If you spend time amid a large group of people, you can glean the general rumors, gossip, or opinions held. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to overhear information.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to overhear information.

name: Ghost
description: You can slowly pass through physical barriers at a rate of 10 feet (3 m) per round (minimum of one round to pass through any barrier). You can't act (other than moving), but you can perceive while phased within a barrier or object, which allows you to peek through walls. You cant pass through energy barriers.
tooltip: You can slowly pass through physical barriers at a rate of 10 feet per round. You can perceive while phased within a barrier or object.

name: Giv'n Her All She's Got
description:
You are the go-to person when it comes to altering the functionality of systems aboard starships or similar vessels (space stations, undersea explorers, etc.) A system might be weapons, shields, thrusters, Vox engines, sensors, etc. Most of your Abilities require you to be at a console of some kind, possibly in the bowels of the engine room.

Select one system to be specialized in. You are able to push that system beyond its normal capabilities whenever you wish.
tooltip: You push the system you've specialized in beyond its normal capabilities.

name: Glissade
description: You create a patch of slippery ice in front of you, allowing you to move a long distance away. You can move in any direction you choose within long range if you have a clear and unobstructed path to that location, and you're not going straight up (would need some kind of angle).
tooltip: You create a patch of slippery ice in front of you, allowing you to move a long distance away.

name: Go Big
description: Your weapon is much bigger than before, requiring a battery backpack to operate. It now deals damage in a cone, affecting up to 3 targets in front of you at once.

name: Go Defensive
description: When you wish, while in combat, you can enter a state of heightened awareness of threat. You're silenced while in this state, but you cannot receive Intrusions or get mixed successes from physical Tasks or Attacks. This effect lasts for as long as you wish or until after you Attack a target, or if no combat is taking place within range of your senses. Once the effect of this Ability ends, you can't enter it again until you've had a Rest.
tooltip: You enter a state of heightened awareness, becoming silenced but avoiding Intrusions and mixed successes from physical Tasks or Attacks.

name: Go to Ground
description: You move up to a long distance and attempt to hide. When you do, add a die to your dice pool for a stealth Task to blend in, disappear, or otherwise escape the senses of everyone previously aware of your presence.
tooltip: You move up to a long distance and attempt to hide

name: Goad
description: If a target within short range has not yet Attacked you, you can goad it so that it does Attack you.
tooltip: You goad a target within short range that has not yet Attacked you so that it does Attack you.

name: Gotta Know
description: Regardless of whether you gain the Insight or not, you will always lose at least 1 XP if Insight is offered by the GM, and it's a situation where you would be able to gain that Insight.
tooltip: Regardless of whether you gain the Insight or not, you will always lose at least 1 XP if Insight is offered by the GM.

name: Gotta Go Fast
description: You can move a short distance and perform another Task as a part of the same Action, or move a long distance. Either way, you automatically succeed at your movement (but must still roll for the Task, if moving a short distance). You cannot perform Feats as your second Action.
tooltip: You automatically succeed at moving a short distance to perform another Task (which you roll for), or moving a long distance.

name: Grab & Toss
description: You can grab and throw a target as a single Action, dealing damage in the process.
tooltip: You can grab and throw a target as a single Action, dealing damage in the process.

name: Grand Deception
description: If you spend your Action trying to convince an intelligent being that can understand you and isn't hostile of something that is wildly and obviously untrue, add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool as you try to convince an intelligent being of something that is wildly and obviously untrue.

name: Greater Ethereal Entity
description: You reach into the nether and summon an otherworldly entity from a portal that uses Fire Magic to Attack its targets. It acts as you direct each round. Directing the entity is an action, and you can command it only when you are within long range of it. Without a command, the entity continues to follow your previous command. You can also give it a simple action, such as Wait here, and Attack anyone who comes within short range until they're dead. The entity lasts for ten minutes, and adds your Magic die to its Attacks if it uses Magic to Attack. Once it dies, it disintegrates into nothing. Action to create; Action to direct.
tooltip: You summon an otherworldly entity from a portal that uses Fire Magic, remains for 10 minutes and then disintegrates.

name: Greater Ethereal Entity
description: You reach into the nether and summon an otherworldly entity from a portal that acts as you direct each round. Directing the entity is an Action, and you can command it only when you are within long range of it. Without a command, the entity continues to follow your previous command. You can also give it a simple Action, such as Wait here, and Attack anyone who comes within short range until they're dead. The entity lasts for ten minutes, and adds your Magic die (and your type of Magic, if you have one) to its dice pool for its Attacks. Once it dies, it disintegrates into nothing. Action to create; Action to direct.
tooltip: You summon an otherworldly entity from a portal that remains for 10 minutes and then disintegrates.

name: Greater Frenzy
description: When you wish, while in combat, you can enter a state of greater frenzy. While in this state, you are silenced, but you add two dice to your dice poll on all physical Tasks (including Attacks). This effect lasts for as long as you wish, but it ends if no combat is taking place within range of your senses. You can perform this Feat or your Tier 1 Frenzy Ability, but you can't use both at the same time.
tooltip: You can enter a state of greater frenzy, silencing yourself but adding two dice to your dice poll on all physical Tasks.

name: Greater Risks
description:
You have a 1d10 which is specific to your weapon. Instead of rolling for Tech, Magic, Logic or Feelings, you roll this 1d10 when using this weapon. It takes priority over all over dice in your dice pool, and so will always be the last one you remove if you're asked to remove a die from your pool (if you are using your weapon when such modifications come into play). You must choose a number between 2 and 10 every time you fire the weapon. If you roll below your number, you fail the roll and get an Intrusion. If you roll above your number, you succeed on the roll. If you roll your number exactly, you deal damage and inflict the equivalent effect. The higher your number, the stronger the effect will be. The lower your number, the less impact your weapon will have when you succeed.

Should you lose your weapon, you'll likely find or construct a new one within a day or so. Possible results of your roll include:

  1. Automatic Intrusion
  2. Taunt
  3. Distract
  4. Fear
  5. Daze
  6. Confuse
  7. Pacify
  8. Silence
  9. Stasis
  10. Banish
tooltip: Select a number between 2 and 10, and roll 1d10 whenever you use your experimental weapon. This die has priority over all others.

name: Grounding
description: You immediately take a Rest and restore a small amount of health.
tooltip: You immediately take a Rest and restore a small amount of health.

name: Group Call to Action
description:
You call upon your fellow radicals for a minor favor such as help finding someone or assistance in flooding a congressional office with calls. Usable once per day.

You may now also perform this Feat to summon a large number of people to a location to protest your cause.
tooltip: You call upon your fellow radicals for a minor favor, or to convene on a specific location to protest.

name: Guilty!
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you socially interact with someone you previously designated guilty. A being is guilty of a particular crime or of terrible deeds in general. You must in someway reference what the being is guilty of to receive this benefit.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you socially interact with someone you previously designated guilty.

name: Hack
description: You gain access to a desired bit of information in a computer or similar deviceor to access one of its primary functions.
tooltip: You gain access to a desired bit of information in a computer or similar deviceor to access one of its primary functions.

name: Handy
description: Your tradeskill knowledge adds one die to your roll when attempting to craft entirely new Items within your spheres of knowledge and the limits of possibility within the setting.
tooltip: Add one die to your roll when attempting to craft an Item for a tradeskill you're trained in.

name: Hard Target
description: You move a short distance on your turn, ignore all negative mixed success effects or Intrusions for the round (though you can still fail your movement roll).
tooltip: You move a short distance on your turn, ignore all negative mixed success effects or Intrusions for the round.

name: Harm's Way
description: Enemies have no trouble choosing you as a target. They'll most often target you over your allies, even when doing so would be a strategic error on their part.
tooltip: Enemies will most often target you over your allies, even when doing so would be a strategic error on their part.

name: Haunt Location
description: You commune with a spiritual remnant within immediate range and request they remain in the area, invisible to all others for twenty-four hours. At any time during that duration, you can concentrate to see, hear, and smell through the remnant, no matter how far you move from it. The remnant doesn't grant you sensory capabilities beyond the norm. Action to create; Action to check.
tooltip: You request a spirit remnant within immediate range stay in the area for twenty-four hours.

name: Hazardous Zone
tooltip: Small objects swirl around you, adding a die to all social Tasks and making you ignore mixed successes in combat for 1 minute.

name: Heads-up Display
description: Your armour comes with systems that help you make sense of, analyze, and use your weapons in your environment. When you trigger this Ability, add a die to your dice pool on one Attack roll as the suit perfectly outlines targets and steadies your aim, regardless of whether you're making a melee or ranged Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on an Attack roll as the suit perfectly outlines targets and steadies your aim.

name: Heal Thyself
description: Once per session you may perform an additional Short Rest. Whenever you perform this Feat, you also heal yourself of all diseases and poisons. Some illnesses may be incurable.
tooltip: Once per session you may perform an additional Short Rest, healing yourself of all diseases and poisons in the process.

name: Health Pack
description: By applying a health pack directly to any targetincluding yourselfyou are able to restore a small amount of its health. Each time you attempt to heal the same target, remove a die from your dice pool. Your dice pool returns to normal after you've had a Long Rest.
tooltip: You apply a health pack to a target, restoring a small amount of its health. Remove a die from your dice pool on repeat use.

name: Heat Manipulation
description: You increase or decrease the temperature of an object touched by roughly 50F (~28C). In either case, the object is probably difficult to hold and may scald those who try.
tooltip: You increase or decrease the temperature of an object touched by roughly 50F.

name: Heat Manipulation
description: You increase or decrease the temperature of an object within long range by roughly 50F (~28C). In either case, the object is probably difficult to hold and may scald those who try.
tooltip: You increase or decrease the temperature of an object within long range by roughly 50F.

name: Hedge Magic
description: Your powers are mysterious, and some would debate if you even really use Magic at all. However, if you don't already use Magic, your Abilities from your Focus use Primal Magic. It is very rare for someone to develop the necessary Skill set to learn Primal Magic, as it relies heavily on the individual being able to connect with nature on a fundamental level, resulting in a symbiotic relationship that benefits the individual as well as the flora and fauna they interact with.
tooltip: Your powers are mysterious and clandestine. If you don't already use Magic, you can now and your Abilities from your Focus use Primal Magic.

name: Helping Out
description: Whenever you choose to help another character, add a die to your dice pool regardless of your training in that Skill.
tooltip: You help another character, adding a die to your dice pool regardless of your training in that Skill.

name: Heroic Monster Bane
description: When you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you, add three dice to your dice pool on your Attack roll.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool when you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you.

name: Hidden Potential
description: Once per day, you automatically succeed on any given Task through a sudden burst of physical or mental prowess.
tooltip: Once per day, you automatically succeed on any given Task through a sudden burst of physical or mental prowess.

name: Hidden Reserves
description: Add two dice to your dice pool for any physical Task (including Attacks) if you perform it immediately after taking a Rest.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool for any physical Task (including Attacks) if you perform it immediately after taking a Rest.

name: While the Iron Is Hot
description: There are two kinds of apocalypse survivors; the quick, and the dead. You make two Attacks against the same target as a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You make two Attacks against the same target as a part of the same Action.

name: Hit Them Where it Hurts
description: Add two dice to your dice pool when fighting people, but not animals, artificial constructs or other non-sentient things.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when fighting people, but not animals, artificial constructs or other non-sentient things.

name: Hitch a Ride
description:
You place your spirit into the body of a being you choose within short range and remain in that body for up to one hour. Your own body falls down and becomes insensate until this Ability ends. You see, hear, smell, touch, and taste using the senses of the being whose body you inhabit. When you speak, the being you inhabit hears those words in his mind. The being you inhabit can use your dice in place of his own, though they do not have access to your Abilities or Magic. When you take an Action, you use the beings body to perform that Action, using their Abilities in place of your own.

If in an unwilling host, the target can spend their Action each round trying to evict you. You must roll for Magic each time they try to resist you. If you succeed, you then roll to perform the Action of your choice. If you fail, you are returned to your body. If inhabiting a willing host, simply roll to perform the Action of your choice.
tooltip: You place your spirit into the body of a being you choose within short range and remain in that body for up to one hour.

name: Hold Breath
description: You can hold your breath for up to 5 minutes without the use of specialty equipment.
tooltip: You hold your breath for up to 5 minutes without the use of specialty equipment.

name: Hold Your Whiskey
description: If you've had a few drinks (enough to make normal people staggering drunk), add a die to your dice pool on any Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any Task while drunk.

name: Holy Fire
description: You cause a target within long range to burn from within.
tooltip: You cause a target within long range to burn from within.

name: Horde Fighting
description: When two or more targets Attack you at once in melee, you can use them against each other, forcing one of them to Attack or somehow disadvantage its peers.
tooltip: You can use targets against each other, forcing one of them to Attack or somehow disadvantage its peers.

name: Horrify
description: Your Nightmares Attack horrifies the target, dropping the target to its knees (or similar appendages). The target takes damage and is stunned for one round, so that it loses its next turn.
tooltip: Your Nightmares Attack horrifies the target, dealing damage and stunning it for one round.

name: Horrify
description: Your Nightmares Attack horrifies the target, dropping the target to its knees (or similar appendages). The target is stunned for one round, so that it loses its next turn.
tooltip: Your Nightmares Attack horrifies the target, stunning it for one round.

name: Hot to the Touch
tooltip: You are shrouded in flames, causing something to catch fire near you involuntarily every round.

name: Hover
description: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement to remain motionless in the air or float up to a short distance as your Action; otherwise, you drift with the wind or with any momentum you have gained. This effect lasts for up to ten minutes.
tooltip: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement in the air as your Action.

name: Hover
description: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement to remain motionless in the air or float up to a short distance as your Action; otherwise, you drift with the wind or with any momentum you have gained. This effect lasts for up to ten minutes.
tooltip: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement in the air as your Action.

name: Hovering
tooltip: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement in the air as your Action.

name: Hovering
tooltip: You float slowly into the air. If you concentrate, you can control your movement in the air as your Action.

name: Hunt Down Prey
description: When tracking, looking for, interacting with, or hiding from your chosen target, add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when tracking, looking for, interacting with, or hiding from your chosen target.

name: Hunt Quarries
description: Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting one of your quarries.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting one of your quarries.

name: Hunt Quarry
description: Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting your chosen quarry.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting your chosen quarry.

name: Hunter's Drive
description: Through force of will, you grant yourself greater prowess in the hunt. Add two dice to your dice pool on one Task involving your quarry. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on one Task involving your quarry. Must Rest between each use.

name: I Just Can't
description: You are unable to land a killing blow, cause lasting harm or force someone to do something against their will. Any time you would perform a Task that would result in one of these outcomes, you automatically fail and receive an Intrusion.
tooltip: Any time you would perform a Task that would kill, cause lasting harm to, or compromise someone, you fail and receive an Intrusion.

name: I Need It
description: You're addicted to new experiences. Whenever you're confronted with an opportunity to indulge in vice, perform a single die Logic roll (without any modifiers). If you succeed, you refrain from indulging in the vice. If you fail, you get to indulge in the vice, but face the consequences of the failed roll.
tooltip: Roll for Logic whenever you're confronted with a vice. If you fail, you face the consequences of indulging in that vice.

name: Ice Abilities
description: If you possess Abilities that would normally use force or other energy, they instead use cold and ice. Your Abilities also have a chance to freeze the enemy in place for one round, stopping them from moving or taking any Actions during that time. They can still speak and use Abilities that do not require movement. This effect cannot occur two rounds in a row.
tooltip: Your Abilities have a chance to freeze the enemy in place for one round, stopping them from moving or taking any Actions during that time.

name: Ice Creation
description: You create a solid object of ice, that is crude and can have no moving parts, such as a sword, shield, or short ladder. Your ice objects are as strong as iron, but if you're not in constant contact with them, they function for only 1d6+6 rounds before breaking or melting. For example, you can make and wield an ice sword, but if you give it to another PC, the sword won't last as long for that character.
tooltip: You create a solid object of ice that lasts only 1d6+6 rounds before breaking or melting.

name: Ice Fan
description: You create an explosion of icicles and frost at a point within long range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The icicles and frost inflicts damage to everything within the area as they fan out from their central nexus.
tooltip: You create an explosion of icicles and frost at a point within long range, inflicting damage to everything within the area.

name: Ice Wall
description: You create an opaque, stationary barrier of solid ice within immediate range. The barrier is slightly wider and taller than your height, is only as thick as it needs to be and lasts for ten minutes. It can be placed anywhere it fits, whether against a solid object (including the ground) or floating in the air.
tooltip: You create an opaque, stationary barrier of solid ice within immediate range that lasts for ten minutes.

name: Icy Layer
description: You have an icy layer of frost that covers you at all times. Beings, surfaces and objects are chilled by your touch.
tooltip: You have an icy layer of frost that covers you at all times. Beings, surfaces and objects are chilled by your touch.

name: Icy Layer
description: You have an icy layer of frost that covers you at all times. Beings, surfaces and objects are chilled by your touch.
tooltip: You have an icy layer of frost that covers you at all times. Beings, surfaces and objects are chilled by your touch.

name: Identify Quarries
description: Select up to three beings as quarry. You must be able to see all three beings. Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting these beings. You can only have up to three quarry at a time, and can only change quarries every 24 hours, or whenever you've captured or disposed of one of your targets. Make a note of your quarries now.

name: Ignore Reason
description: Your GM may, as an Intrusion, cause you to decide that a situation thats clearly out of your depth is completely within your ability. You cannot refuse this Intrusion, though you still get XP for it.
tooltip: Your GM may give you an Intrusion you can't refuse that causes you to decide to do something stupid.

name: Ignore the Pain
description: Combat status effects (such as daze, stun, etc.) that only last for one round have no effect on you.
tooltip: Combat status effects (such as daze, stun, etc.) that only last for one round have no effect on you.

name: Illuminating Touch
description: You touch an object, and that object sheds light to illuminate everything in short range. The light remains until you use an Action to touch the object again.
tooltip: You touch an object, and that object sheds light to illuminate everything in short range.

name: Immobilizing Attack
description: You hit your target such that your whip wraps around their legs (or other limb), which prevents your target from moving on their next Action in addition to dealing damage. As long as you maintain tension with the whip and take no Action on your subsequent turns, your target remains held unless they manage to escape.
tooltip: You hit your target, preventing them from moving on their next Action in addition to dealing damage.

name: Immolation Aura
description: Flames harmless to you form a tracery over your entire body and emit faint heat. The flames are harmless to you and your allies, though they will burn anyone or anything else that comes into contact with them.
tooltip: Flames harmless to you form a tracery over your entire body and emit faint heat, burning hostile entities who come too close.

name: Impart Ideal
description: If you spend your Action imparting a specific ideal onto a target who can hear and understand you, add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task. An ideal is different than a specific suggestion or command; an ideal is an overarching value such as all life is sacred, my political party is the best, children should be seen, not heard, and so on. An ideal influences a targets behavior but doesn't control it.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for a Task if you take the time to impart an ideal onto a target.

name: Impersonate
description: You alter your voice, posture, and mannerisms, whip together a disguise, adding a die to your dice pool for any attempt to impersonate someone else, whether it is a specific individual (Bob the cop) or a general role (a police officer).
tooltip: You impersonate a specific person or general role, adding a die to your dice pool for the Task.

name: Impervious
description: It ain't how hard you hit; it's about how hard you can get hit, and keep moving forward. You do not get mixed successes; whenever you get a single successful die roll, it counts as a full success.
tooltip: You do not get mixed successes; whenever you get a single successful die in a roll, it counts as a full success.

name: Impossible Leap
description: You jump up to a long distance away, to a location you can see.
tooltip: You jump up to a long distance away, to a location you can see.

name: Improved First Blood
description: You automatically get a critical success on your first Attack roll if you are the first one to Attack in any given combat encounter. Only works for the first round of combat and if you are using a firearm for the Attack.
tooltip: Automatically get a critical success on your first Attack roll if you are the first one to Attack and you are using a firearm.

name: Improved Monster Bane
description: When you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you, add two dice to your dice pool on your Attack roll.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on your Attack roll when you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you.

name: Improved Skirmish Team
description: You designate two characters to be part of your skirmish team. You can change who your skirmish team is everytime you Rest, and you can only have up to two people plus yourself in your skirmish team at one time. As long as one or both of your skirmish team comrades are within immediate range of you, you all ignore the negative effects of mixed successes, and you can trade the effects of Intrusions because you have each other's backs. You still fail the roll even if you trade the Intrusion.
tooltip: Skirmish teammates within immediate range of each other ignore the negative effects of mixed successes and can freely exchange Intrusions.

name: Improvise
description: When you perform a Task in which you are not trained, you can improvise to add an additional die to your dice pool for the Task. This may manifest as a tool you cobble together, a sudden insight into overcoming a problem, or a rush of dumb luck. You can only do this once between Long Rests.
tooltip: You improvise on a Task you're not trained in to add an additional die to your dice pool for the Task.

name: Improvise Explosive
description: You make a device do something different from its original purpose. For example, a blaster becomes a bomb. A scanner becomes a bomb. A music player becomes...a bomb. You can only perform this Feat to make explosives.
tooltip: You make a device do something different from its original purpose. You can only perform this Feat to make explosives.

name: Inanimate Objects
description: The kinds of objects affected by your Focus must be smaller than one cubic meter in volume and cannot be an Artifact.
tooltip: The kinds of objects affected by your Focus must be smaller than one cubic meter in volume and cannot be an Artifact.

name: Incarnation of Rage
description: While berserk, you can spend an Action to retain your rational mind, allowing you to choose where to move and who to Attack for one round. You still have the benefits of being berserk if you succeed.
tooltip: You attempt to retain your rational mind, allowing you to choose where to go and who to Attack for one round.

name: Incinerate
description: With a touch, you incinerate one non living object that is smaller than you. If the GM feels it appropriate to the circumstances, you can incinerate a portion of an object (the total volume of which is smaller than you) rather than the entire thing.
tooltip: With a touch, you incinerate one non living object that is smaller than you.

name: Incinerate
description: You incinerate one non living object that is smaller using a specialized device. If the GM feels it appropriate to the circumstances, you can incinerate a portion of an object (the total volume of which is smaller than you) rather than the entire thing.
tooltip: You incinerate one non living object that is smaller than you using a specialized device.

name: Inconceivable
description: You may not pay an XP to ignore an Intrusion. Also, your Intrusions tend to be spectacularly gruesome, painful, and unlikely.
tooltip: You may not pay an XP to ignore an Intrusion. Also, your Intrusions tend to be spectacularly gruesome, painful, and unlikely.

name: Increase Blast Radius
description: You modify explosives used or set by you so their blast radius is increased to affect all those in a short radius. Or, if they already affect a larger area than immediate radius, increase the radius to long range.
tooltip: You place or launch an explosive that affects a larger radius than normal. Immediate becomes short, short becomes long.

name: Incredible Feat of Science
description:
You do something amazing in the lab that would normally be impossible. This takes a full day of work (or longer, depending on the circumstances) and parts and materials equivalent to three Expensive Items. Possible incredible feats include:

  • Reanimate and command a dead body for one hour.
  • Create an engine that runs on perpetual motion.
  • Create a teleportation gate that remains open for one minute.
  • Transmute one substance into another substance.
  • Cure one person with an incurable disease or condition.
  • Create a weapon designed to hurt something that cant otherwise be hurt.
  • Create a defense designed to protect against something that cannot otherwise be stopped.
tooltip: You do something amazing in the lab that would normally be impossible. This takes a full day of work, as well as the necessary parts and materials.

name: Incredible Running Speed
description: You move much farther than normal in a round. This means as a part of another Action, you can move up to a long distance. As an Action, you can move up to 200 feet (61 m) without needing to roll. Your second Action can be a Feat, if you so choose.
tooltip: You move up to a long distance and take another Action in the same round, or move up to 200 feet without needing to roll.

name: Infected
description: You are infected with a disease that no one truly understands. Perhaps you contracted the infection from someone else, or maybe it was something you caught while exploring some ruins. Whatever the case may be, your infection causes you to remove a die from all physical and social Tasks. There are ways to mitigate these effects.
tooltip: Remove a die from all physical and social Tasks. There are ways to mitigate these effects.

name: Influence
description: You have a knack for getting people to do what you want. Add one die to your dice pool when trying to influence someone.
tooltip: You have a knack for getting people to do what you want. Add one die to your dice pool when trying to influence someone.

name: Information Gathering
description: You communicate wirelessly with any or all machines and beings connected to machines within 1 mile (2 km). You can ask one basic question about themselves or anything happening near them and receive a simple answer. For example, while in an area with many machines, you could ask Where is the ravage bear? and if the creature is within a mile of you, one or more machines or beings connected to machines will probably provide the answer.
tooltip: You communicate wirelessly to ask one basic question to any or all machines and beings connected to machines within 1 mile.

name: Infuse Spirit
description: When you kill a being or destroy a spirit remnant with an Attack, if you choose, its spirit (if unprotected) immediately infuses you, and you regain a portion of your health. The spirit remnant is destroyed in the process.
tooltip: You can choose to infuse the spirit of a being or spirit you killed or destroyed to regain a portion of your health.

name: Innocent!
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you socially interact with someone you previously designated as innocent. Someone who is labeled innocent can be innocent in a certain circumstance, or they can be generally innocent of terrible crimes (such as murder, major theft, and so on). You must reference what you believe the person is innocent for to be able to perform this Feat.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you socially interact with someone you previously designated innocent.

name: Innovate
description: You can modify any Artifact to give it different abilities permanently, though the modified Artifact will be less powerful than it was previously.
tooltip: You modify an Artifact to give it different abilities permanently, though it will be less powerful than it was previously.

name: Insatiable
tooltip: You are not be able to roll Magic until you satiate your hunger for Magical energy.

name: Inscrutable
description: No matter how hard they try, people just can't seem to figure you out. You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes on social Tasks.
tooltip: You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes on social Tasks.

name: Insect Swarm
description: You call a swarm of insects in a place where it is possible for insects to appear. They remain for one minute, and during this time, they do as you command while they are within long range. They can swarm about and interfere with the Actions of any or all targets in an area, or you can focus the swarm and Attack all targets within immediate range of each other (all within long range of you). The Attacking swarm inflicts damage each round until the targets move or you cancel the effect. You can also command the swarm to move heavy objects through collective effort, eat through wooden walls, and perform other Actions suitable for a supernatural swarm. Each command requires an Action.
tooltip: You call an insect swarm for one minute, having them Attack targets, or perform other physical Actions suitable for such a swarm.

name: Inspire
description: Through stories, songs, art, or other forms of entertainment, you inspire your friends. After spending twenty-four hours with you, once per day each of your friends, can add a die to their dice pool for any Task without you needing to roll to help. This benefit is ongoing while you remain in the friends company. It ends if you leave, but it resumes if you return to the friends company within twenty-four hours. If you leave the friends company for longer than that, you must spend another twenty-four hours together to reactivate the benefit.
tooltip: Once per day, you can add a die to each of your friend's rolls without rolling to help.

name: Inspiring Sacrifice
description: Whenever you die, party members who saw your death regain a small amount of health.
tooltip: Whenever you die, party members who saw your death regain a small amount of health.

name: Inspiring Success
description: When you win, everybody wins. Whenever you get a critical success, one of your allies within short range automatically succeeds on their roll that round.
tooltip: Whenever you get a critical success, one of your allies within short range automatically succeeds on their roll that round.

name: Insult
description:
You insult a target within long range, adding an additional die to your dice pool to cause severe emotional harm over a long period of time. The trauma can be suppressed if a target spends an Action doing nothing but calming and centering itself.

Add two dice to your dice pool when performing this Feat if the target was successfully traumatized by one of your previous insults, and hasn't had the chance to resolve it. If the GM allows it, insults from other sources might trigger this effect as well.
tooltip: You insult a target within long range, adding an additional die to your dice pool to cause severe emotional harm over a long period of time.

name: Intellectual Weakness
description: You aren't too bright, and never could think your way through things. When a situation would normally ask that you roll for Logic, you do not roll your Logic die. This means you will need to rely on Magic or Tech to solve the problem, or automatically fail the roll. You could also always reason that Feelings is more appropriate, though the GM will need to agree with you.
tooltip: You aren't too bright, and never could think your way through things. You cannot roll for Logic, and must rely on Magic or Tech to solve Logic-based Tasks.

name: Intellectually Stagnant
description: You don't like it when you have to think your way through a problem. You prefer action to studying or problem-solving. As such, you always roll for Feelings over Logic, even if the situation would demand for the latter. While this has no impact on what you're capable of doing, Intrusions from Tasks that should have been handled with Logic will be more intense (unless you can justify using Feelings instead of Logic).
tooltip: You always roll for Feelings over Logic. Intrusions from Tasks that should have been handled with Logic are more intense.

name: Intelligent Conversation
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any social interaction.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any social interaction.

name: Intelligent Interface
description: You can speak telepathically with any intelligent machine within long range. Such machines and automatons that normally would never communicate with a human might talk to you.
tooltip: You speak telepathically with an intelligent machine within long range.

name: Interface
description: By directly plugging into a device, you can identify and learn to operate it.
tooltip: By directly plugging into a device, you can identify and learn to operate it.

name: Internal Alignment
description: You are immune to the effects of all diseases and poisons.
tooltip: You are immune to the effects of all diseases and poisons.

name: Intimidated
tooltip: Remove one die from your dice pool when dealing with a threat that previously intimidated you.

name: Introspective
description: Spending so much time by yourself has made allowed you to build layers of protection against those would cause you emotional harm. You ignore Intrusions from social interactions, though you still fail the roll.
tooltip: You have layers of protection against those would cause you emotional harm, ignoring Intrusions from social interactions.

name: Invade Mind
description: You can read the surface thoughts of a being within short range, even if the target doesn't want you to. You must be able to see your target. Once you have established contact, you can read the targets thoughts for up to one minute. If you also have the Mind Reading Ability from your type or another source, you can perform this Feat at long range, and you don't need to be able to see the target (but you do have to know that the target is within range).
tooltip: You read the surface thoughts of a being within short range for up to 1 minute, even if the target doesn't want you to.

name: Invent
description: You can create new Artifacts in half the time by spending half the normal XP.
tooltip: You create a new Artifact in half the time by spending half the normal XP.

name: Investigate
description:
To really shine as an investigator, you must engage your mind and body in your deductions. You can declare your roll as either being a Logic, Feelings, Magic or Tech roll, regardless of what the GM has previously declared as long as you are investigating something.

You dont necessarily need to have access to Magic or technology to perform a Magic or Tech roll; if you dont have access to these tools, youre essentially just using your knowledge in these concepts to help you investigate.
tooltip: As long as you're investigating, you can declare your roll as either being a Logic, Feelings, Magic or Tech roll.

name: Investigative Skill
description:
You are trained in a Skill in which you are not already trained. Choose one of the following:

  • Identify
  • Lockpicking
  • Perception
  • Tinkering Skill (specific type of device)

name: Invisibility
description: You become invisible for ten minutes. While invisible, you are almost imperceptible to others. This effect ends if you do something to reveal your presence or positionAttacking, using an Ability, moving a large object, and so on. If this occurs, you can regain the remaining invisibility effect by taking an Action to focus on hiding your position. Action to initiate or reinitiate.
tooltip: You become invisible for ten minutes. This effect ends if you do something to reveal your presence or position.

name: Iron Fist
description: Add a die to your dice pool for unarmed Attacks.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for unarmed Attacks.

name: Iron Muscles
description: Add a die to your dice pool when attempting any physical Task requiring body strength. Does not work on Attack rolls.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when attempting any physical Task requiring body strength. Does not work on Attack rolls.

name: Iron Will
description: Fear. Doubt. Remorse. You've conquered them all. Try as they might to break you, your targets will find that you are not so easily swayed. Intrusions and mixed success effects cannot compromise your state of mind, nor daze, stun or make you do something you'd otherwise not choose to do.
tooltip: Intrusions and mixed success effects cannot compromise your state of mind or make you do something you'd otherwise not choose to do.

name: It's Them
description: You are prone to seeing threats that aren't there. When you are in the presence of strange phenomena or subjected to great stress (such as a serious physical threat), the GM can use Intrusion to direct your next Action without awarding XP. You can still pay 1 XP to refuse the Intrusion. The GMs influence is your paranoia taking over and thus is always something you would not likely do otherwise. It may have a negative impact on your allies, though it isn't usually directly harmful. For example, you might suddenly become unduly suspicious of a friendnot so much as to Attack them outright, but enough to avoid coming to them aid while they are under Attack by a third party.
tooltip: When you are subjected to great stress, the GM can use Intrusion to direct your next Action without awarding XP.

name: Jump Attack
description: You attempt to jump high into the air as part of your melee Attack. If you succeed, your Attack knocks the target down. If you fail, your Attack still lands and does damage as normal.
tooltip: You jump high into the air and make a melee Attack, knocking the target down if you succeed, but still damaging them if you fail.

name: Jury-rig
description: You quickly create an object using what would seem to be entirely inappropriate materials. You can make a bomb out of a tin can and household cleaners, a lockpick out of aluminum foil, or a sword out of broken furniture. Generally, the object can be no larger than something you can hold in one hand, and it functions for at most one encounter. You can't change the nature of the materials involved. For example, you can't take iron rods and make a pile of gold coins or a wicker basket.
tooltip: You quickly create an object using what would seem to be entirely inappropriate materials that functions once.

name: Just Lucky
description: When you fail your roll, you can reroll without spending XP. If you fail a second time, the GM can use an Intrusion normally.
tooltip: When you fail your roll, you can reroll without spending XP. If you fail a second time, the GM can use an Intrusion normally.

name: Just Try to Hit Me
description:
Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy through your method of choice (persuasion, intimidation, etc.) to Attack you directly. If you succeed, the enemy then rolls as a PC would, with stricter success criteria than an unmodified player character would get. The number of dice the enemy rolls depends on how much of a threat they are. Insignificant threats may just get an Intrusion without rolling.

  • Failure (0) - Intrusion against the enemy
  • Minor Failure (1) - The enemy fails to damage you, and you retaliate in response
  • Mixed Success (2) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack, but they also take damage as retaliation
  • Success (3) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack; you do not succeed in defending against them
tooltip: Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy to perform an Attack roll on you, with stricter success criteria than normal.

name: Justified Action
description: You are an enthusiastic upholder of the law. When you are engaged in an activity that directly upholds the law, add a die to your dice pool for the related Task.
tooltip: When you are engaged in an activity that directly upholds the law, add a die to your dice pool for the related Task.

name: Justified Hatred
description: Add a die to your dice pool when fighting civilized aliens.
