tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your wards.

name: Protector
description: You designate a single character to be your charge. You can change this freely every round, but you can have only one charge at a time. As long as that charge is within immediate range, they cannot get Intrusions from combat because you have their back (though they still fail the roll).

name: Psi Barrier
description: You create a wall of Psi energy within short range. Can cover an area slightly wider and taller than your height, and is of negligible thickness. The barrier lasts for about an hour, or until it has taken sufficient damage.
tooltip: You create wall of Psi energy within short range that lasts for about an hour.

name: Psi Blast
description: You integrate psionic energy into your suit, allowing you to project blasts of Psi energy from the gauntlets of your power armour. These blasts inflict damage with a range of 200 feet (61 m).
tooltip: You project blasts of Psi energy from the gauntlets of your power armour with a range of 200 feet.

name: Psi Explosion
description: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The blast inflicts damage to everything the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Psi Explosion
description: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The blast inflicts damage to everything the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Psi Explosion
description: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The blast inflicts damage to everything the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion of Psi energy at a point within long range, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Psi Field
description: Psi energy radiates from your entire body, emitting faint light to those sensitive to such things. Your touch alone can cause psychic damage to anyone left unguarded to psionic Attack.
tooltip: Psi energy radiates from your entire body. Your touch alone can cause psychic damage to anyone left unguarded to psionic Attack.

name: Psi Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are tapping into the unbound power of Psi. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and all of your Magical Abilities use Psi Magic.

name: Psi Slice
description: You Attack a target within long range using Psi Magic, slicing through their flesh and mind alike.
tooltip: You Attack a target within long range using Psi Magic, slicing through their flesh and mind alike.

name: Psi Slice
description: You Attack a target within long range using Psi Magic, slicing through their flesh and mind alike.
tooltip: You Attack a target within long range using Psi Magic, slicing through their flesh and mind alike.

name: Psi Storm
description: You summon a nexus of pure psionic energy centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m). The area within 250 feet (76 m) is saturated with visible psionic energy for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Objects and structures randomly disintegrate under the stress of such power, causing building to collapse, walls to topple and cliffs to crumble. Creatures and characters inside collapsed buildings or beneath a crumbling cliff or falling wall are subject to crushing damage and may have to dig themselves free, as the GM decides. Creatures and characters can also be damaged by the psionic energies directly.
tooltip: You summon a nexus of pure psionic energy five minutes, causing widespread damage to characters, creatures, structures and terrain in the area.

name: Psi Trick
description: Requires a free hand. You can perform small tricks using Psi Magic: temporarily change the color or basic appearance of a small object, cause small objects to float through the air, clean a small area, mend a broken object, prepare (but not create) food, and so on. Cannot be used to cause harm.
tooltip: You perform a small parlor trick using Psi Magic. Cannot be used to cause harm.

name: Psionic Burn
description: Psi energy visibly suffuses the flesh of the target you touch, inflicting damage and rendering the target unable to move on its next Action.
tooltip: Inflict damage to a target and render them unable to move on their next Action.

name: Psionic Burst
description: You blast waves of psionic energy into the minds of up to three targets within short range.
tooltip: You blast waves of psionic energy into the minds of up to three targets within short range.

name: Psionic Dash
description: When you move as your Action, you move as far as you can see, as long as there is an unobstructed path to the location desired. If you could normally move to a location over several Actions, you can arrive in one Action by performing this Feat.
tooltip: You move as far as you can see, as long as there is an unobstructed path to the location desired.

name: Psionic Spike
description: You inflict a destructive psychosis in the mind of a target within long range, dealing damage each round. The psychosis can be dispersed if a target spends an Action doing nothing but calming and centering itself.
tooltip: You inflict a destructive psychosis in the mind of a target within long range, dealing damage each round.

name: Temporal Waves
description: Time is just another dimension in reality, stretching forwards and backwards, sending ripples through to the present as events shape both past and future. Through the use of Psi Magic, you are able to pick up on these ripples to predict future events, with the possibility of even shaping what is to come. If you don't already have Magical powers, your Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: If you don't already have Magical powers, you can now use Magic and your Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic to predict and shape future events.

name: Psychedelic Abilities
description:
If you have telepathic Abilities, they can also incite hallucinations in the target. This alteration changes nothing other than what the target sees when you Attack them. For example, your Attack might look like a monster made of energy that assails your targets. If you have the Stasis Ability, it might look to the victim like a tentacled beast holds them in place.

Unless otherwise decided by you and the GM, your Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: If you dont already have Magical powers, you can now use Magic and your telepathic Abilities incite hallucinations in your target, changing what the target sees when you Attack them.

name: Psychic Passenger
tooltip: Your spirit inhabits the body of another being, controlling their Actions, using their abilities and experiencing the world through them.

name: Psychokinetic Attack
description: You can use this Attack in one of two ways. The first is to pick up a heavy object and hurl it at someone within short range, dealing damage to the target and to the hurled object (which could be another target, although that would require two rollsone to grab the first target and another to hit the second target with the first). The second way to use Psychokinetic Attack is to unleash a shattering burst of power that destroys objects.
tooltip: You hurl an object or target into another at short range, or destroy an object.

name: Pull a Fast One
description: Whether you're running a con, picking a pocket, fooling or tricking a dupe, sneaking something by a guard, and so on, add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you're running a con, picking a pocket, sneaking something by a guard, and so on.

name: Pump for Info
description: If you ask a question to someone who trusts you, they must answer truthfully. They can only provide information which they could realistically know.
tooltip: You ask a question to someone who trusts you, which they must answer truthfully.

name: Punch Through
description: Spotting an opportunity, you make a quick Attack using shipboard weapons, adding three dice to your Attack pool on the Attack. Can only use once between Rests.
tooltip: Spotting an opportunity, you make a quick Attack using shipboard weapons, adding three dice to your Attack pool on the Attack.

name: Punish All the Guilty
description: You can Attack all targets within immediate range that you have designated as guilty. Anything that modifies your Attack or damage applies to all Attacks.
tooltip: You can Attack all targets within immediate range that you have designated as guilty.

name: Punish the Guilty
description: If you Attack someone you have designated as guilty, add a die to your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you Attack someone you have designated as guilty.

name: Punish the Unruly
description: To govern means to punish those who disobey the rules or who otherwise betray the trust of the people, as represented by you. Add a die to your dice pool for your Attack if punishing someone disobeying the rule of law.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for your Attack if punishing someone disobeying the rule of law.

name: Pure Heart
description: Your innocence is kind of off-putting to people, as you tend to take everything at face value. You do not get Intrusions in social interactions, though you can still fail rolls.
tooltip: Your innocence is kind of off-putting to people. You do not get Intrusions in social interactions, though you can still fail rolls.

name: Push
description: You push a target an immediate distance in any direction you wish. You must be able to see the target, which must not be affixed to anything and must be within short range. The push is quick, and the force is too crude to be manipulated. For example, you can't use this to pull a lever or close a door.
tooltip: You push a target an immediate distance in any direction you wish.

name: Push Off
description: You can make precise, point-to-point jumps in microgravity, which means you can move up to a long distance and make a melee Attack or attempt to grab a targe. Your movement must be towards a target, and your second Action must involve your target (that your perform once you reach them).
tooltip: You move a long distance and take another Action in the same round, such as a melee Attack or a grab.

name: Push on Through
description: You ignore the effects of terrain while moving.
tooltip: You ignore the effects of terrain while moving.

name: Push the Limits
description: When you wish it, your body radiates Aura Magic, infusing you with the strength you need to automatically succeed on one physical Task, including Attacks. You must Rest between each use of this Ability.
tooltip: Your body radiates Aura Magic, infusing you with the strength you need to automatically succeed on one physical Task, including Attacks.

name: Quarry
description: Choose a quarry (a single individual creature or character that you can see). Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task involving following, understanding, interacting with, or fighting that creature or character. You can have only one quarry at a time, and can only change quarries every 24 hours, or whenever you've captured or disposed of your target. Make a note of your quarry here.

name: Quick Attack
description: If you're using a small, fashionable weapon, you can avoid the negative effects of a mixed success roll in combat.
tooltip: You Attack using a small, fashionable weapon. If you get a mixed success, ignore the negative effects and treat the roll as a success.

name: Quick Draw
description: If you have two small, light weapons at the ready (such as throwing weapons, pistols, daggers, etc.), you can make two consecutive Attacks on the same target as a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You can make two consecutive Attacks on the same target as a part of the same Action using small, light weapons.

name: Quick Shot
description: You shoot a quick shot from your energy bow. If you get a mixed success on the Attack, treat the Attack as if you succeeded.
tooltip: You shoot a quick shot from your energy bow. If you get a mixed success on the Attack, treat the Attack as if you succeeded.

name: Quick Strike
description: You make a melee Attack with such speed that it is hard for your target to defend against, and it knocks them off balance, dazing them for one round. It takes you one less die to succeed with this Attack, meaning you can never fail, and at worst get a mixed success.
tooltip: You make a melee Attack that dazes your target for one round. You only need one die to succeed, meaning you can only get a mixed success at worst.

name: Quick Study
description: You learn from repetitive actions. You automatically succeed on a Task you previously succeeded at (such as operating the same device or making Attacks against the same target). Once you move on to a new Task, the familiarity with the old Task fadesunless you start doing it again. If you previously failed or got a mixed success on a Task, you cannot perform this Feat.
tooltip: You automatically succeed on a Task you previously succeeded at. Once you move on to a new Task, the familiarity with the old Task fades.

name: Quick Work
description: In a moment of brilliance, you make an Artifact do something it would normally not be able to do. It must be something the Artifact could logically do.
tooltip: In a moment of brilliance, you make an Artifact do something it would normally not be able to do.

name: Racial Preference
description: You get along much better with other Aeyen, though Terrans or T'avs also tend to appreciate your company. Add a die to your dice pool when having positive social interactions with Terrans, T'avs or other Aeyans.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when having positive social interactions with Terrans, T'avs or other Aeyans.

name: Radio Link
description: You open a specialized link using advanced technology with another character in immediate range. The link remains active regardless of distance and lasts for one hour.
tooltip: You open a specialized link using advanced technology with another character in immediate range for one hour.

name: Rally on Me
description: Being brave in the face of adversity requires an assurance that ones defenses are sound. You or a target within short range ignores the effects of mixed successes until the end of the next round.
tooltip: You or a target within short range ignores the effects of mixed successes until the end of the next round.

name: Ramming Speed
description: When you use a vehicle or ship as a weapon, add a die to your dice pool on your Attack roll. If your target is significantly smaller than your vehicle, you automatically succeed on the Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to dice pool on your Attack if you use your vehicle or ship as a weapon.

name: Ranger
description:
Rangers are soldiers specialized in ranged combat, physical dexterity and exploration. Often they choose to become snipers, archers, trackers, trappers, lancers or hunters. The Erelen, K'ohma and T'av all have a rich history of Rangers among their guard, though the Erelen in particular are renowned for their elite jungle Rangers.

Select this type over the Soldier type if you'd like something more specialized towards ranged abilities; select Soldier if you'd like more versatility or access to more melee abilities.

name: Rapid Attack
description: Once per round, you can make an additional Attack with your chosen weapon. This means you can Attack twice as a part of the same Action, as long as you are Attacking using your chosen weapon.
tooltip: You Attack twice as a part of the same Action with your chosen weapon.

name: Rapid Shot
description: You can move a short distance and make a ranged Attack as a part of the same Action. You can only use your second Action to make a ranged Attack.
tooltip: You move a short distance and make a ranged Attack as a part of the same Action.

name: Re-center Self
description: You now only need one tenth of the amount of food, water, and sleep as normal. You can take your regular Short Rest and take another Action within the same round. Only usable once between Long Rests. You can perform a Feat for your second Action, if you so wish.
tooltip: You take your regular Short Rest and take another Action within the same round.

name: Reaction
description: If a creature or character Attacks you with a melee Attack as a part of an Intrusion or mixed success negative effect, you gain an Action to Attack them or move a short distance away, even if you have already taken a turn in the round.
tooltip: You counterAttack a creature or character or move a short distance away from them after being Attacked, even if you already acted that round.

name: Read the Signs
description: You examine an area and learn precise, useful details about the past (if any exist). On your next Action, you can ask the GM a question that they must answer honestly, as long as it has to do with the past of the area you've examined. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You can ask the GM a question about a specific area's past, as long as you take an Action to examine it.

name: Reboot
description: In addition to your normal short and Long Rests each day, you canat any time between Long Restsspend an Action to Rest. This is effectively the same as a Short Rest.
tooltip: You spend an Action to Rest at any time, effectively Short Resting whenever you wish.

name: Reckoning
description: If you Attack a target who you have observed in combat (against someone else or against yourself) for at least one round, add a die to your dice pool on your next Attack against this same target.
tooltip: If you Attack a target who you have observed in combat for at least one round, add a die to your dice pool on your next Attack against this same target.

name: Reclaim Artifact
description: When attempting to acquire an Artifact that is within view, add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks related to its acquisition.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if trying to acquire an Artifact in view.

name: Recondite
description:
Psi Magic is the most powerful Magic in modern history, in due part to how easy it is to harness and exploit. With Psi Magic, an individual can animate objects, see far off places, see into the future, invade the minds of others, teleport, control temperature or manifest energy into the physical world. What's more, Psi Magic can be greatly enhanced by crystals, which are plentiful thanks to their use as a power source. Almost all civilized species have the ability to learn Psi Magic, but only the Aeyen, Erelen and Terrans have the infrastructure to properly train and regulate Recondites.

As a Recondite, you have access to specialization Foci specific to your type:

  • is Cryokinetic
  • is Electrokinetic
  • is Pyrokinetic
  • is the Eye of the Storm
  • Masters Clairvoyance
  • Masters Telekinesis
  • Separates Mind From Body
  • Teaches Other Recondites
  • Worships Dark Beings

name: Recondite Tracker
description: You can sense the presence of a Recondite within long range and attempt to lock on to it. If you succeed, you always know the distance and direction to it.
tooltip: You sense a Recondite within long range and attempt to lock on to it. If you succeed, you always know the distance and direction to it.

name: Recondite Wrecker
description: Add a die to your dice pool when Attacking a Recondite.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when Attacking a Recondite.

name: Reconstruction
description: Using your mastery over the elements, you reconstruct matter around you to create a new object. The object must be composed of matter at your disposal, but you can transmute the matter into any other matter if you so desire (with some exceptions). Once created, the Item lasts for 1d6 hours.
tooltip: Using your mastery over the elements, you reconstruct matter around you to create a new object composed of matter at your disposal.

name: Recover
description: You are able to take an additional Short Rest in between your Long Rests. You can only use Recover once in between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You immediately take a Short Rest. This is in addition to your standard Short Rest that you take in between Long Rests.

name: Redirect Attacks
description: When you are the target of an Attack, you can attempt to redirect it using a defense roll. If you succeed, you can direct the Attack to another target in immediate range. You can perform this Feat as many times as you are Attacked in any given round, even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You attempt to redirect an Attack against you towards a target in immediate range.

name: Rejuvenate
description: With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any target, including yourself. Each time you attempt to heal the same target, remove a die from your dice pool. Your dice pool returns to normal after you've had a Long Rest.
tooltip: With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any target, including yourself. Remove a die from your dice pool on repeat use.

name: Remote Control
description: You can use a starships communication and sensor arrays to launch an Attack that briefly renders an enemy starship within Attack range inoperative for up to a minute.
tooltip: While on a starship, you launch an Attack that briefly renders an enemy starship inoperative for up to a minute.

name: Remote Surveillance Drone
tooltip: You have an immobile, well-hidden scouting drone that you can see, hear and smell through.

name: Remote Viewing
description:
Distance is an illusion, as all space is one space. With great concentration, you can see another place. This Feat can be performed in one of two ways:

  • Pick a spot a specific distance away and in a specific direction. For one minute, you see from that vantage point, as if that was where you stood.
  • Think of a place that you have seen before, either conventionally or using the other application of this power. For one minute, you see from that vantage point, as if that was where you stood.

    • Either application takes anywhere from one Action to hours of concentration, depending on what the GM feels is appropriate due to time, distance, or other mitigating circumstances. However, you don't know in advance how long it will take. Action to initiate; Action each round to concentrate.
tooltip: You are able to see a location some distance away for one minute.

name: Repair Components
description: You attempt to repair a damaged Cyberware component, healing yourself in the process. This Ability can also remove status effects if they're related to your Cyberware (such as being blind because your cybernetic eye was damaged).
tooltip: You attempt to repair a damaged Cyberware component, healing yourself in the process and removing related status effects.

name: Reputation Precedes You
description: People know of your notorious exploits, which have been told and retold so many times that they bear little resemblance to reality. But people fear your name when they recognize you (or you declare yourself). They become so afraid that they become dazed if you spend at least one round announcing yourself or ensuring that they recognize you for who you are. The effect lasts until your targets successfully land an Attack on you or your allies.
tooltip: Daze all hostile targets in long range who recognize you. Lasts until they land an Attack on you or your allies.

name: Reroute
description: You reduce power from a system and redirect it into another system of your choice, adding a die for those who use that system for one round.
tooltip: You reduce power from a system and redirect it into another system of your choice, adding a die for those who use that system for one round.

name: Reshape
description: You reshape matter within short range in an area no larger than a 5-foot (1 m) cube. If you spend only one Action on this Ability, the changes you make are crude at best. If you spend at least ten minutes and succeed at an appropriate crafting Task, you can make complex changes to the material. You can't change the nature of the material, only its shape. Thus, you can make a hole in a wall or floor, or you can seal one up. You can fashion a rudimentary sword from a large piece of iron. You can break or repair a chain. With multiple uses of this Ability, you could bring about large changes, making a bridge, a wall, or a similar structure.
tooltip: You reshape matter in a 5-foot cubic area. A single Action makes crude changes. Ten minutes allows complex changes to the material.

name: Reshape Matter
description: Your mastery of telekinesis is so great that you can reshape objects on a molecular level. You can affect a single object no larger than you, which must be visible and close enough to touch. You can perform this Feat to damage the object, or you can attempt a crafting Task to reshape the object into another form.
tooltip: You can reshape an object on a molecular level, damaging the object, or you can attempt to reshape the object into another form.

name: Resident Spirit
tooltip: You are connected to an invisible, stationary spirit remnant that you can see, hear, and smell through.

name: Resist the Elements
description: You resist heat, cold, and similar extremes. You ignore environmental ambient damage, as well as ambient damage applied by Abilities as a lasting effect.
tooltip: You ignore environmental ambient damage, as well as ambient damage applied by Abilities as a lasting effect.

name: Respect
description: People of lower social class often treat you with deference. A few, however, secretly treat you with contempt. Whenever you interact with people from a lower economic or social class, roll 1d4 instead of your regular dice pool. On a 1, get an Intrusion. Otherwise, you succeed on your interaction. You must perform this Feat during social encounters with people from a lower social or economic class.
tooltip: Roll 1d4 when you interact with people from a lower economic or social class. On a 1, get an Intrusion. Otherwise, you succeed.

name: Restoration
description: With a touch, you restore a modest amount of health to any target, including yourself.
tooltip: With a touch, you restore a modest amount of health to any target, including yourself.

name: Restore Vitality
description: With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any target, including yourself. Each time you attempt to heal the same target, remove a die from your dice pool. Your dice pool returns to normal after you've had a Long Rest.
tooltip: With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any Target, including yourself. Remove a die from your dice pool on repeat use.

name: Restore Vitality
description:
With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any target, including yourself.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: With a touch, you restore a small amount of health to any target, including yourself.

name: Retainer or Mount
description:
You start with a:

  • Servant
  • Vehicle
  • Mount

You and the GM should work out the details.

name: Rewrite History
description: You completely rewrite a single memory a target holds, so long as you know that memory exists.
tooltip: You completely rewrite a single memory a target holds, so long as you know that memory exists.

name: Ride & Shoot
description: You can make an Attack with a ranged weapon and attempt a riding Tasksuch as urging your mount to jump a ravineas a single Action. You cannot use your second Action to use perform another Feat.
tooltip: You make an Attack with a ranged weapon and attempt a riding Task as a single Action.

name: Roaming Third Eye
description:
You visualize a place within long range and cast your mind to that place, creating a mobile, invisible sensor for one minute or until you choose to end this Ability. While using your third eye, you see through your sensor instead of your eyes using your normal visual Abilities. You may perceive the area around your body using your other senses as normal.

When you perform your Third Eye Feat, you can place the sensor anywhere within long range. In addition, until that Ability ends, you can use an Action to move the sensor anywhere within short range of its starting position.
tooltip: You visualize a place within long range, creating a mobile, invisible sensor you can see through for up to one minute.

name: Robot Army
description: All of your robots now benefit from the upgrades done to your robot assistant. If using Mounted Laser Configuration, all robots transform at the same time.
tooltip: All of your robots now benefit from your robot assistant's upgrades.

name: Robot Control
description: You use your knowledge of robot command and control (and possibly devices that transmit on the proper frequency) to affect any mechanized system or robot within short range. You can render several targets inactive for as long as you focus all your attention on them. If you focus on just one target, you can attempt to take active control of it for one minute, commanding it to do simple Tasks on your behalf while you concentrate.
tooltip: You control a single system or robot within short range for one minute, or render several targets inactive for as long as you focus on them.

name: Robot Upgrade
description:
Select one of the three Tier 3 Abilities below to modify your artificial assistant with one new capability. Options include the following:

  • Force Shield
  • Robotic Flight
  • Mounted Laser Configuration

name: Robotic Flight
description: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.

name: Robotic Flight
description: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.

name: Rock Barrier
description: You create a stationary barrier of rock within immediate range. The barrier is slightly wider and taller than your height, is only as thick as it needs to be and lasts for ten minutes. It can be placed anywhere it fits, as long as it's against rock, earth or a similar element.
tooltip: You create a stationary barrier of rock within immediate range.

name: Run & Fight
description: You can move a short distance and make a melee Attack a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You move a short distance and make a melee Attack as a part of the same Action.

name: Run Around
description: You cause a target to think you went one way when you in fact went somewhere else. As a part of the same Action, you perform a short move and attempt a stealth Task. You cannot use your second Action to perform a Feat.
tooltip: You move a short distance and attempt a stealth Task as a part of the same Action.

name: Run from Danger
description: Sometimes you just can't handle pressure, and so must run from the world. After taking an Action on your turn, you can move up to a short distance, or get behind or beneath cover within immediate range. You cannot use your second Action to perform a Feat.
tooltip: You take an Action and then move up to a short distance, or get behind or beneath cover within immediate range.

name: Running Away
description: You move up to 200 feet (61 m) in one round as long as you are not moving towards a target.
tooltip: You move up to 200 feet (61 m) in one round as long as you are not moving towards a target.

name: Running Speed
description: You move much farther than normal in a round. This means that as a part of another Action, you can move up to a short distance. As an Action, you can move a long distance without needing to roll. You can perform a Feat as your second Action, if you so choose.
tooltip: You move up to a short distance and take another Action in the same round, or move a long distance without needing to roll.

name: Rush In
description: Without the time you would waste on thinking, you're able to act on instinct alone, giving you an almost supernatural sense of the world around you. If you go first in an encounter, you cannot fail or get an Intrusion on your roll; you can only get a mixed success at the very worst.
tooltip: You go first in an encounter. You cannot fail or get an Intrusion on your Task roll; you can only get a mixed success at the very worst.

name: Sabotage
description: You sabotage the normal functioning of a device, machine or construct so that it fails at an inopportune time for the user.
tooltip: You sabotage the normal functioning of a device, machine or construct so that it fails at an inopportune time for the user.

name: Sacrifice
description: You stop a ticking time bomb, a grenade or an area-of-effect Magic Attack by throwing yourself into the nexus of the explosive force. You die, but the Attack will no longer cause area damage.
tooltip: You stop an area-of-effect Attack by throwing yourself into the nexus of the force, dying in the process but preventing all damage.

name: Sadism
description: You revel in the pain of others. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to deceive, intimidate or persuade a being experiencing physical or emotional pain.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to deceive, intimidate or persuade a being experiencing physical or emotional pain.

name: Salvage & Comfort
description: You're familiar with open space. Using your crafts sensors, you can find salvage in the form of abandoned spacecraft, drifting motes of matter that were once inhabited, or a place to hide from pursuit in what most people would otherwise assume to be empty space (such as in a nebula, an asteroid field, or the shadow of a moon). Salvage you turn up includes enough food and water for you and several others, as well as the possibility of weapons, clothing, Technological Artifacts, survivors, or other usable Items.
tooltip: Using your crafts sensors, you find space-borne salvage, including food and water, weapons, clothing, Technological Artifacts or survivors.

name: Savage
description: The K'ohma are not meant for space travel. They are seen as savage by most people. Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with aliens, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with aliens, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Save Yourself
description: You're first to the exit in a fire or other disaster, going so far as pushing an ally out of the way to save yourself. If there's a character or creature in immediate range, you can transfer an Intrusion to them. However, doing so makes you fall down or otherwise become unable to act in the next round. You can perform this Feat even if you've already acted this round.
tooltip: You transfer an Intrusion to a target in immediate range, but you become prone or stunned the following round.

name: Scan
description: You scan an area equal in size to a 10-foot (3 m) cube, including all objects, characters or creatures within that area. The area must be within short range. Scanning a target always reveals how powerful, dangerous, or difficult it is. You also learn whatever facts the GM feels are pertinent about the matter and energy in that area. For example, you might learn that the wooden box contains a device of metal and synth. You might learn that the glass cylinder is full of poisonous gas, and that its metal stand has an electrical field running through it that connects to a metal mesh in the floor. You might learn that the creature standing before you is a mammal with a small brain. However, this Ability doesn't tell you what the information means. Thus, in the first example, you don't know what the metal and synth device does. In the second, you don't know if stepping on the floor causes the cylinder to release the gas. In the third, you might suspect that the creature is not very intelligent, but scans, like looks, can be deceiving. Many materials and energy fields prevent or resist scanning.
tooltip: You scan a 10-foot cubic area within short range, revealing how powerful or dangerous it is, and any facts pertinent to the area.

name: Scavenge Artifact
description: You've developed a sixth sense for searching for the most valuable Items in ruins and wrecks. If you expend the time required to succeed on two scavenging Tasks, you can exchange all the results you would otherwise obtain for a chance to gain an Artifact of the GMs choosing. You can perform this Feat at most once per day, and never within the same general area.
tooltip: You expend the time required to succeed on two scavenging Tasks to gain an Artifact of the GMs choosing.

name: Scientific Assistance
description: Whenever you choose to help another character, if the Task they are trying to accomplish is scientific in nature, they automatically succeed on the Task (including Attacks, if using an advanced scientific weapon) if you get a mixed success or higher on your help roll.
tooltip: You help another character with a scientific Task so that they automatically succeed if you get a mixed success or higher.

name: Scout Drone
description: You place an immobile, well-hidden scouting drone within immediate range that lasts for one hour. At any time during that duration, you can concentrate to see, hear, and smell through the drone, no matter how far you move from it. The drone doesn't grant you sensory capabilities beyond the norm. Action to create; Action to check.
tooltip: You place an immobile, well-hidden scouting drone within immediate range that lasts for one hour.

name: Scouting Ahead
description: Instead of defending against the next source of incoming environmental damage, you die, letting everyone know about any dangerous traps or physical properties to the area. If there's a way to avoid or move over the source of danger, you teammates do so without issue. Otherwise, they add a die to their dice pool when traversing the dangerous terrain you died in.
tooltip: You die, letting everyone know about danger in the area, or adding a die to their movement rolls when traversing the dangerous terrain.

name: Scramble Machine
description: You render one machine within short range unable to function for one round. Alternatively, you can cause a machine (or the person attempting to use the machine) to be dazed for one minute.
tooltip: You render one machine within short range unable to function for one round, or cause it to be dazed for one minute.

name: Secret Ritual
description: You perform a half hour ritual, immediately after which you automatically get a critical success on a roll involving Magic or a Skill you're trained in.
tooltip: After a half hour ritual, you automatically get a critical success on a roll involving Magic or a Skill you're trained in.

name: See the Future
description: Based on all the variables you perceive, you can predict what will happen next. Add a die to your dice pool for one Task involving perception or social interaction.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for one Task involving perception or social interaction.

name: See the Unseen
description: You can perceive beings and objects that are normally invisible, out of phase, or only partially in this universe. This Ability also helps with looking for things that are more conventionally hidden.
tooltip: You perceive beings and objects that are normally invisible, out of phase, or only partially in this universe.

name: See the Unseen
description: You can perceive beings and objects that are normally invisible, out of phase, or only partially in this universe. This Ability also helps with looking for things that are more conventionally hidden.
tooltip: You perceive beings and objects that are normally invisible, out of phase, or only partially in this universe.

name: Seeds of Fury
description: You cause growths from the plant you choose to begin growing on a target in long range. The Attack deals immediate damage and the growths continue blooming, inflicting damage each round for up to a minute or until the target spends an Action to rip out or stamp the growths.
tooltip: You cause plant growths to grow on a target in long range, dealing damage each round for up to a minute or until the target rips them out.

name: Seeking Perfection
description: When you roll to perform a physical Task, you ignore any negative effects when you get a mixed success. This means you only need one successful die roll to get a full success.
tooltip: Roll to perform a physical Task, ignoring any negative effects when you get a mixed success.

name: Seize the Initiative
description: If you have investigated something related to your current Task, you can take an additional Action this turn. Only one of your Actions can be a Feat.
tooltip: You can take an additional Action this turn if you have investigated something related to your current Task.

name: Self Delusion
description: You alter one of your own memories to whatever you wish it to be.
tooltip: You alter one of your own memories to whatever you wish it to be.

name: Self Mastery
description: You are able to pull on multiple different Skill sets to accomplish your goals. You can reroll a single die each time you roll, as long as you roll a different die each time. For example, if you fail a Logic roll, you can reroll it as Feelings, or as a Tech die. You must justify why the reroll would work, with the means to accomplish what you are trying to justify. You wouldn't be able to do a Magic roll if you don't have access to Magic, for example.
tooltip: You can reroll a single die each time you roll, as long as you roll a different die each time and can justify why the reroll would work.

name: Self-sacrifice
description: You sacrifice part of your mortal shell (a modest amount of damage), allowing you to automatically succeed on your next non-physical Task or Action. You cannot perform this Feat if you are near death.
tooltip: You sacrifice part of your mortal shell, allowing you to automatically succeed on your next non-physical Task or Action.

name: Selfless
description: What you do, you do only for the happiness of others. Other players cannot award you XP from Intrusions, even if you're the only person around.
tooltip: Other players cannot award you XP from Intrusions, even if you're the only person around.

name: Send Out Feelers
description: Through your extensive trade network, you find out the source of a particular Item.
tooltip: Through your extensive trade network, you find out the source of a particular Item.

name: Sense Magic
description:
You are able to sense the use of Psi Magic or similar effects in the world around you. You can sense them from afar, and if you get within long range of such a thing, you can sense whether it has ill intent or not.

If you don't already have Magical Abilities, you use Psi Magic to power this Ability. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You sense the use of Psi Magic or similar effects within long range.

name: Sensor Array
description: You use your starships sensory instruments to ask a general question about a location to the GM, such as How many people are in the mining colony? or Where did the other spacecraft crash?, and they must answer truthfully. You can use this as many times as you want, but the information is limited by what is observable through sensor data.
tooltip: You use your starships sensory instruments to ask a general question about a location to the GM and they must answer truthfully.

name: Sensual Aura
description: Your allies now benefit from the raw sexual energy you exude. If your allies are wearing sexy clothing while within immediate range of you, they can use Sex Appeal as their Action.
tooltip: If your allies are wearing sexy clothing while within immediate range of you, they can use Sex Appeal as their Action.

name: Sensual Performance
description: Using your body as the primary instrument, you perform something that captures the interest of everyone within short range, taking their attention away from something else in the area. You can use an Action to keep everyone's attention each round.
tooltip: You perform something that captures the interest of everyone within short range, taking all of their attention for as long as you perform.

name: Sentry Mode
tooltip: The robot acts as an autonomous turret, Attacking targets on its own. If fired by a character, add a die to the dice pool for the Attack.

name: Sentry Mode
tooltip: The robot acts as an autonomous turret, Attacking targets on its own. If fired by a character, add a die to the dice pool for the Attack.

name: Separation Anxiety
tooltip: Both you and your friend remove a die from your dice pools on ALL Tasks.

name: Set to Kill
description: Add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using the ranged weapons stored in your ship (but not owned specifically by you), such as laser pistols or rifles.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using the ranged weapons stored in your ship, such as laser pistols or rifles.

name: Set to Stun
description: This Attack stuns your target for 1d6 rounds. You can perform this Feat in place of your normal weapon roll.
tooltip: This Attack stuns your target for 1d6 rounds. You can perform this Feat in place of your normal weapon roll.

name: Set Trap
description: You are skilled at creating simple traps, especially varieties of deadfalls and snares using natural objects from the environment. When you lay a trap, decide whether you want to hold the victim in place (a snare) or inflict damage (a deadfall). You must have the necessary materials handy to create the trap.
tooltip: You lay a trap, either to hold the victim in place or inflict damage. You must have the necessary materials handy to create the trap.

name: Sex Appeal
description: Theres something about you that others find attractive. If you are wearing clothing normally considered sexually attractive, add a die to any positive social interaction Task.
tooltip: If you are wearing clothing normally considered sexually attractive, add a die to any positive social interaction Task.

name: Shadow Force
description: You Attack a target within long range using a burst of shadow energy that assails his physical form. You must be able to see your target.
tooltip: You Attack a target within long range using a burst of shadow energy that assails his physical form. You must be able to see your target.

name: Shadow Magic
description: Whenever you use Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are unleashing the ravenous nightmare that is Shadow Magic. If you already have Magical Abilities, they are tainted by Shadow Magic, but still use their Magic of origin. Shadow Magic is a powerful, yet dangerous Magic that drains its user as much as it does whomever the Magic is aimed at. A Magic of pure destruction, its manifestation alone is enough to erase reality around its nexus. Anyone who is found using Shadow Magic is normally consumed from within before long.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Shadow Magic, and your other Magical Abilities are tainted with it.

name: Shadow Magic
description: Whenever you use Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are unleashing the ravenous nightmare that is Shadow Magic. If you already have Magical Abilities, they are tainted by Shadow Magic, but still use their Magic of origin. Shadow Magic is a powerful, yet dangerous Magic that drains its user as much as it does whomever the Magic is aimed at. A Magic of pure destruction, its manifestation alone is enough to erase reality around its nexus. Anyone who is found using Shadow Magic is normally consumed from within before long.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Shadow Magic, and your other Magical Abilities are tainted with it.

name: Shadow Warrior
description: Why risk yourself when it's so much safer to strike from the shadows? Some time ago, you decided it was better to get things done with subtlety, to attack with surprise, to subvert conventional means to get what you wanted. And with this decision, you became a spy, operative, hunter, assassin or thief. Your concept of honour is questionable, but you are a capable warrior nonetheless, using speed and finesse to accomplish your goals.

name: Shadowy Abilities
description: If you have other overt Abilities (Magic, psionic powers, or the like), they make almost no sound, and whatever visual displays they produce are dark and shadowy. Additionally, your Abilities have a chance to cause affected targets to become rooted with fear, being unable to act for one round.
tooltip: Your Abilities have a chance to cause affected targets to become rooted with fear, being unable to act for one round.

name: Shadowy Explosion
description: You create an explosion of shadowy energy at a point within long range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The blast inflicts damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion of shadowy energy at a point within long range, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Shaman
description:
Shaman are critical members of K'ohma or T'av tribal society, providing spiritual guidance and acting as mouthpieces for the deceased. They call on these same, asking for wisdom and imbuing objectsor even themselveswith their power.

Shaman use Spirit Magic to achieve thisa barely understood and often overlooked Magic by more advanced civilizations. As a Shaman, you also have access to the following specialization Foci:

  • Masters Clairvoyance
  • Seperates Mind From Body

name: Shape Life
description: You alter the physical properties of a target that you touch, changing their physical form for up to ten minutes. These changes can affect their weight, temperature or physical appearance. This process does not harm the target and they retain their intelligence (if they have any) throughout the process, though they may become unable to communicate once transformed. If you want to perform this Feat to cause harm, remove one die from your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: You alter the physical properties of a target that you touch, changing their physical form for up to 10 minutes.

name: Shapeshift
description: You change into a natural beast or sentient plant, such as a wolf, bear, or treant, for up to one hour. While in your new form, you are not able to roll for Logic or Magic (even if another Ability allows you to), but you add two dice to your dice pool on all physical Tasks for the duration. Reverting to your normal form requires an Action, and you can't shapeshift again until after your next Rest.
tooltip: You change into a beast or sentient plant, adding two dice to your dice pool all physical Tasks for up to one hour.

name: Shapeshifted
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool all physical Tasks for up to one hour while shapeshifted into a beast or sentient plant.

name: Share Focus
description:
You pick one person to be your closest frienda friend so close that you forge a bond that takes on supernormal qualities. You gain any and all Abilities of your friends Focus, and you both gain Abilities (and potentially drawbacks) from your Focus (this one).

To initiate the bond, both characters need to pick Forges a Bond as their primary Focus, and then select the same Focus they both share as their secondary Focus.
tooltip: You gain any and all Abilities of your friends Focus, and you both gain Abilities (and potentially drawbacks) from your Focus (this one).

name: Shatter
description: You interrupt the fundamental force holding normal matter together for a moment, causing the detonation of an object you choose within long range. The object must be a small, mundane Item composed of homogeneous matter (such as a clay cup, an iron ingot, a stone, and so on). The object explodes in an immediate radius, dealing damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: You detonate a mundane object composed of homogeneous matter, which explodes, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Shatter
description: You interrupt the fundamental force holding normal matter together for a moment, causing the detonation of an object you choose within long range. The object must be a small, mundane Item composed of homogeneous matter (such as a clay cup, an iron ingot, a stone, and so on). The object explodes in an immediate radius, dealing damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: You detonate a mundane object composed of homogeneous matter, which explodes, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Shield Master
description: When you use a shield, shield matrix or energy shield, you can choose to spend your turn defending against the negative effects of a mixed success roll in combat, negating said effects. But if you do so, you cannot perform your intended Action that round.
tooltip: You can choose to spend your turn defending against the negative effects of a mixed success in combat, sacrificing your intended Action that round.

name: Shield Training
description: If you use a shield, you ignore the effects of Intrusions in combat (though you still fail the roll).
tooltip: If you use a shield, you ignore the effects of Intrusions in combat (though you still fail the roll).

name: Shockwave
description: You stomp on the ground with all of your strength, creating a shock wave that Attacks everything in immediate range. Affected targets take damage and are either pushed out of immediate range or fall down (your choice).
tooltip: You create a shock wave that Attacks everything in immediate range, pushing targets out of immediate range or knocking them down.

name: Show of Force
description: Pebbles, dirt, sand, and debris rise into the air around you to form a swirling cloud. The cloud extends out to immediate range, moves with you, and lasts for as long as you want. However, you can only move an immediate range each round while the cloud is active. When it ends, all the materials fall to the ground around you. The cloud makes it harder for creatures and characters to Attack you. In addition, while the cloud is around you, you can use an Action to whip the material so that it abrades everything within immediate range.
tooltip: You surround yourself with a swirling cloud of matter that moves with you. You can damage everything within immediate range at will.

name: Show Them the Way
description: Your presence overwhelms a target you can touch and ask to aid you. Essentially, you control the Actions of the target for up to ten minutes who fails to defend against your presence. Once you have established control, you maintain control through verbal instruction. You can allow the target to act freely or override control on a case-by case basis. When the effect ends, the target vaguely remembers doing your will, but its as blurry as a dream.
tooltip: You control the Actions of a target you touch for up to ten minutes, maintaining control through verbal instruction.

name: Shroud of Flame
description:
At your command, your entire body becomes shrouded in flames. The fire doesn't burn you, but it automatically inflicts damage to anyone and anything who tries to touch you or strike you with a melee Attack. You are also immune to fire for duration.

Every round this Ability is active, something or someone close to you catches fire. Action to initiate; Action to cancel.
tooltip: Your entire body becomes shrouded in flames, inflicting damage to everything in immediate range until cancelled.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Skill With Firearms
description:
Choose one type of firearm in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns

You are trained in Attacks using that type of firearm.

name: Skill With Firearms
description:
Choose one type of firearm in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns

You are trained in Attacks using that type of firearm.

name: Skilled Problem Solver
description: Whenever you are presented with a puzzle, problem or complex situation, you may ask the GM for one hint. This can only be done once per problem you are trying to solve. When dealing with multiple problems in succession, the GM decides how many hints to provide.
tooltip: Whenever you are presented with a puzzle, problem or complex situation, you may ask the GM for one hint.

name: Skirmish Team
description: You designate two characters to be part of your skirmish team. You can change who your skirmish team is everytime you Rest, and you can only have up to two people plus yourself in your skirmish team at one time. As long as one or both of your skirmish team comrades are within immediate range of you, you all ignore the negative effects of mixed successes in combat because you have each other's backs.
tooltip: Skirmish teammates within immediate range of each other ignore the negative effects of mixed successes in combat.

name: Slay
description: When you get your exact number or a critical success on an Attack roll, you can kill the target outright. If your target is a PC, the character is near death instead. You must Rest between each use of this Ability.
tooltip: You Attack your target, killing them outright if you roll your exact number or a critical success.

name: Sleeping Giant
description: When you forgo your Action, add two dice to your dice pool for a Task in the next round. If you forgo your Action twice in a row, add three dice to your dice pool for a Task in the next round. You can perform this Feat for Attacks and other Task rolls.
tooltip: Forgo your Action to add two dice to your dice pool in the next round, or forgo your Action twice in a row to add three dice instead.

name: Slippery Customer
description: You escape from bonds or fit in a tight space to avoid danger.
tooltip: You escape from bonds or fit in a tight space to avoid danger.

name: Smoke Bomb
description: You produce a cloud of smoke within short range, allowing everyone within the immediate affected area to ignore the negative effects of mixed successes from combat rolls. The cloud dissipates in 1d6 rounds.
tooltip: You produce a cloud of smoke so that everyone within immediate area ignore the negative effects of mixed successes from combat rolls.

name: Smoke Bomb
description: You produce a cloud of smoke within long range, allowing everyone within the immediate affected area to ignore the negative effects of mixed successes from combat rolls. The cloud dissipates in 1d6 rounds.
tooltip: You produce a cloud of smoke so that everyone within immediate area ignore the negative effects of mixed successes from combat rolls.

name: Snapshot
description: You can make two gun Attacks as a single Action. Roll for each Attack.
tooltip: You make two gun Attacks as a single Action. Roll for each Attack.

name: Sneaky Feet
description: You're sneaky but not fast. You need to succeed on your roll to move a short distance as your Action (as opposed to simply moving as your Action without rolling), and you need a critical success to move a long distance (where you would normally need just a regular success to do so).
tooltip: You're sneaky but not fast. You need to succeed to do a short move, and a critical success for a long move.

name: Snipe
description: If you spend one Action aiming, in the next round you can make a precise ranged Attack, adding three dice to your dice pool on the Attack. If you are Attacked before you can shoot in the next round, the Attack is cancelled.
tooltip: You spend one Action aiming and make a precise ranged Attack in the next round, adding three dice to your dice pool for the Attack.

name: Social Anxiety
description: Spending so much time alone has made you fragile in social situations. If you get a mixed success from a social interaction Task roll, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: If you get a mixed success from a social interaction Task roll, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.

name: Soft-spoken
description: If you get a mixed success on a social Task roll, you fail it instead and get a related Intrusion.
tooltip: If you get a mixed success on a social Task roll, you fail it instead and get a related Intrusion.

name: Soldier
description:
You're a good ally to have in a fight. You know how to use weapons and defend yourself. This might mean wielding a sword and shield in the gladiatorial arena, an assault rifle and a bandolier of grenades in a savage firefight, or a rifle and powered armour when exploring an alien planet. Soldiers are physical, action-oriented people. They're more likely to overcome a challenge using force than by other means, and they often take the most straightforward path toward their goals.

Every civilization has their own incarnation of a soldieranyone who is ready for violence, or even potential violence, might be a soldier in the general sense. This includes warriors, hunters, guards, mercenaries, watchmen, militia, starship pilots, or people in other roles or professions who know how to defend themselves with skill.

name: Solvent
description: You produce a concoction capable of burning through an immobile, nonliving being, slicing up to 1 foot (30 cm) of any material. If used as a weapon, the chemical deals regular damage.
tooltip: You produce a concoction capable of burning through a nonliving being up to 1 foot. If used as a weapon, the chemical deals regular damage.

name: Something About You
description: Others recognize there is something different about you, something that makes them more amenable to paying attention to your desires. Add one die to your dice pool for Tasks related to social interaction.
tooltip: Add one die to your dice pool for Tasks related to social interaction.

name: Soothe the Savage
description: You calm an uncivilized beast within short range. You must speak to it (although it doesn't need to understand your words), and it must see you. It remains calm for one minute or for as long as you focus all your attention on it. The GM has final say over what counts as an uncivilized beasts, but unless some kind of deception is at work, you should know whether you can affect a creature before you attempt to perform this Feat.
tooltip: You calm an uncivilized beast within short range by speaking to it. It remains calm for as long as you focus on it, or up to a minute.

name: Soothe the Savage
description: You calm an uncivilized beast within short range. You must speak to it (although it doesn't need to understand your words), and it must see you. It remains calm for one minute or for as long as you focus all your attention on it. The GM has final say over what counts as an uncivilized beasts, but unless some kind of deception is at work, you should know whether you can affect a creature before you attempt to perform this Feat.
tooltip: You calm an uncivilized beast within short range by speaking to it. It remains calm for as long as you focus on it, or up to a minute.

name: Space Punch
description: By taking advantage of microgravity conditions, you can use inertia and mass to your advantage if engaged in melee. If you spend a round setting up a melee Attack (or a thrown or launched object) while in zero gravity or low gravity conditions, add two dice to your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: You spend a round setting up a physical Attack while in zero or low gravity, adding two dice to your dice pool for the Attack.

name: Speak for the Dead
description: You can ask a question of a spirit remnant within immediate range. Because the answer comes through the filter of the beings understanding and personality, it can't answer questions that it wouldn't have understood in life, and it can't provide answers that it wouldn't have known in life. In fact, the being is not compelled to answer at all, so you might need to interact with it in a way that would have convinced it to answer while it was alive. Each question requires an Action.
tooltip: You ask a question of a spirit remnant within immediate range. It can only answer based on their own understanding and personality.

name: Speaks Prophecy
description:
Seeing the many strands of fate, you can reach out and change the design. Usually, you do so by affecting the fate of another being or object within long range, by introducing a major special effect upon it either immediately or sometime within the next few days, in accordance with your prophecy. If you want to try for a larger effect, and if the GM allows it, you can attempt to alter a destiny with a more far-reaching effect, which is more like the kind of GM Intrusion initiated by the GM on their players. However, the effect may not work out exactly as you hope.

You always critically succeed with this Ability, but you can only use it once per session.
tooltip: You affect the fate of another being or object within long range, either immediately or sometime within the next few days.

name: Special Connection
tooltip: You OR your friend adds a die to any roll in a given round when in immediate range.

name: Special Connection
tooltip: You and your friend add a die to any roll in a given round when in immediate range.

name: Spectacular Armour
description: Your suit provides breathable air for up to eight hours and a comfortable environment even in bitter heat, cold, or underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km); and it allows you to see in the dark up to a short distance. Getting into the suit requires an Action (and, of course, access to your suit). Your power armour also allows you to fly up to a long distance as your Action, or an unlimited distance if unoccupied.
tooltip: Your suit provides breathable air, and allows you to see in the dark. You can also fly up to a long range while in the suit.

name: Speed Burst
description: You can take two separate Actions in this round. In the following round, remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll. You cannot perform this Feat two rounds in a row. You can perform a Feat for your second Action, if you so choose.
tooltip: You can take two separate Actions in this round. In the following round, remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll.

name: Spin Attack
description: If you have a weapon that can reach or Attack multiple targets in quick succession, you can stand still and make Attacks against up to five targets within range, all as part of the same Action in one round.
tooltip: You can stand still and make Attacks against five targets within range as part of the same Action.

name: Spin Identity
description:
You convince all intelligent beings who can see, hear, and understand you that you are someone or something other than who you actually are. You don't impersonate a specific individual known to the victim. Instead, you convince the victim that you are someone they do not know belonging to a certain category of people. We're from the government. I'm just a simple farmer from the next town over. Your commander sent me.

This Ability provides adds a die to your dice pool for any Task where you are trying to impersonate a non-specific person. If you meet any new victims, you must roll again to convince them of your legitimacy. Your ruse remains active for up to an hour, unless your actions or other circumstances reveal your true identity earlier.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task where you are trying to impersonate a non-specific person.

name: Spin Kick
description: You can stand still and make Attacks against all targets within immediate range of you using a deadly spin kick, all as part of the same Action in one round.
tooltip: You can stand still and use a deadly spin kick to Attack all targets within immediate range.

name: Spirit Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are actually connecting with the spirits of the deceased, drawing on their remnant life force to give you otherworldly powers. The primary purpose of Spirit Magic is communication of the dead, but intermediate users of Spirit Magic can imbue spirit remnants into objects or living beings, allowing the deceased person to walk among the living once more.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and all of your Magical Abilities use Spirit Magic. This applies to both offensive and support Abilities.

name: Spirit Projection
description: Your spirit fully leaves your body and manifests anywhere you choose within immediate range. Your projected spirit can remain apart from your body for up to twenty-four hours. This effect ends early if your spirit is sufficiently damaged or if your projection touches your resting body. Your disembodied spirit has a form that looks just like you. It has little physical substance, however, and its frayed edges trail off into nothingness. You control this body as if it were your normal body and can act and move as you normally would with a few exceptions. You can move through solid objects as if they weren't there, and you ignore any terrain feature that would impede your movement. You can't take or deal physical damage; however, you can still take damage from Magic or non-physical Attacks. Your spirit can travel up to 1 mile (2 km) from your body. Your physical body is helpless until this effect ends. You cannot use your senses to perceive anything. For example, your body could sustain a significant injury, and you wouldn't know it. If your body takes enough physical damage, your spirit snaps back to your body, and you are stunned until the end of the next round as you try to reorient yourself to your predicament.
tooltip: Your spirit fully leaves your body and manifests anywhere you choose within immediate range.

name: Spiritual Aid
description: Instead of rolling to help someone, you automatically add a die to their dice pool if you're trained in the Task they're trying to accomplish.
tooltip: You automatically add a die to someone's dice pool when you help if you're trained in the Task they're trying to accomplish.

name: Spot Weakness
description: You spot a critical Technical weakness in an enemy vessel within sensor range, causing your crew to add two dice to their pool on their next Attack against it.
tooltip: You cause your crew to add two dice to their dice pool on their next Attack against an enemy vessel.

name: Spray
description: If a weapon has the ability to fire rapid shots without reloading (usually called a rapid-fire weapon, such as the submachine gun), you can spray multiple shots around your target to increase the chance of hitting.
tooltip: You spray multiple shots around your target with a rapid-fire ranged weapon to increase the chance of hitting.

name: Spray Attack
description: With a large handful of small objectstiny knives, shuriken, stones, jagged bits of metal, coins, or whatever is on handyou Attack every everything in short range.
tooltip: With a large handful of small objects, you Attack everything in short range.

name: Spring Away
description: If you use your Action to move up to a long distance away from a hostile target, you avoid any Intrusions or negative effects for mixed successes involving that target until the end of the next round.
tooltip: You move away from a hostile target, avoid Intrusions and negative effects from mixed successes in the next round.

name: Sprint & Grab
description: You can run a short distance and make a melee Attack to grab a target. A successful Attack means you grab the target and bring it to a halt if it was moving (this can be treated as a tackle, if appropriate). You must use your two Actions to run to a target and then grab it.
tooltip: You can run a short distance and make a melee Attack to grab a target, bringing it to a halt if it was moving.

name: Squad Supporter
description: Three allies you can see come under your protection. Add a die to your dice pool when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting them. You can support one squad at a time, and you can change your squad every time you Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting members of your squad.

name: Squishy
description: Overeating might a fun activity, but it isn't conducive to your physical health. Mixed successes involving physical Tasks automatically fail, and you get an Intrusion as a result.
tooltip: Mixed successes involving physical Tasks automatically fail, and you get an Intrusion as a result.

name: Stab & Run
description: You make a melee Attack and move a short distance as a part of the same Action. You perform Feats as one of your Actions.
tooltip: You make a melee Attack and move a short distance as a part of the same Action.

name: Stage One Infection
description:
Your emotions fluctuate randomly in varying intensity, from intense outbursts of anger to numb coldness. You feel disconnected from others and reality. You have difficulty speaking or thinking. You also have reduced physical dexterity, and experience auditory and visual hallucinations.

Whenever you wish, you can have a Shaman, Keeper, Cleric or Priestess cleanse you to remove the negative social effects (but not the effects on your physical health), though your infection will return in full force within 3 days. Alternatively, you can lean into the infection. In doing so, there's a chance that your actions will not be your own, but there will be no negative social effects (but the effects on your physical health remain) until you decide to resist the infection.
tooltip: You feel disconnected from reality, experience mood swings and mental distress, and your physical health is Moderately compromised.

name: Stage Three Infection
description:
You experience your symptoms with increased intensity, as your body is now afflicted with ulcers, sores, malignant growths and various other open wounds. You have reduced visual acuity, the inability to speak coherently, incredibly amounts of mental and bodily pain, and no appetite, among other symptoms; you are essentially on death's door.

However, once you reach this stage, you and the GM will discuss one of three outcomes based on the Actions you have taken thus far. Either you die in less than a month, you remain as you are indefinitely, or you experience Ascension. Select one of the following after discussing your fate with the GM:

  • Ascension you fully embrace the infection, becoming one with the darkness
  • Anathema you must live with your infection for the rest of your life
  • On Death's Door you die an unpreventable death within less than a month

If you fully embraced the infection for the duration of your time with it, you're more likely to select Ascension. If you spend most of your time with the infection getting it cleansed, you are more likely to select Anathema. If you consistently tried to ignore the diseaseor were not committed to either embracing or cleansing ityou are more likely to die from the illness.

name: Stage Two Infection
description:
You experience Stage One symptoms in reduced intensity, but you now feel increased paranoia and malaise. You also now experience constant bodily pain, localized around growths inside your body. Complications may arise from the locations of the growth. For example, a growth in or around the respiratory system would cause regular respiratory distress.

Whenever you wish, you can have a Shaman, Keeper, Cleric or Priestess cleanse you to remove the negative social effects (but not the effects on your physical health), though your infection will return in full force within 3 days. Alternatively, you can lean into the infection. In doing so, there's a chance that your actions will not be your own, but there will be no negative social effects (but the effects on your physical health remain) until you decide to resist the infection.
tooltip: The infection has caused painful growths to manifest inside your body. You have a general feeling of malaise and paranoia.

name: Stand Guard
description: When you stand guard as your Action, you can Take the Attack for characters you choose that are adjacent to you. Lasts until your next turn.
tooltip: You stand guard, Taking the Attack for characters you choose that are adjacent to you.

name: Stasis
description: You surround a target with Psi energy, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute, as if frozen solid. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While in stasis, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
